man oh man what a ride this one was i chanced the trip to tucson in my van that is edging ever closer to 300000 miles and that is about the payoff i got     the plot is masterful the creature spfx are enormous and rightly deserved the oscar it won and the best part there are no oxygen destroyers no fantasy fictitious scientific weapons nothing but real life applications such as ship cabling and explosive laden aircraft to employ in their frantic effort to take the monster down and the cliffhanger of the dorsal fin shaped radiation burn spreading across the female protagonists neck was the best part  i sincerely hope that there will either be a direct sequel or that yamazaki is tapped to do another kaiju film i know i will be watching

i wanted to wait a bit to make sure it wasnt recency bias but im confident in calling godzilla minus one the best godzilla movie in the franchises 35 catalog with a gripping story of confronting and dealing with grief and guilt the film utilizes godzilla as a perfect representation of the internal and external chaos we encounter in life only by learning to value and cherish his own life does k≈çichi find true purpose in living every human character is incredible in their writing and acting godzilla is a terrifying presence that capitalizes on every element that makes him a great antagonist the low budget is often brought up as part of the mindblowing realization that this movie fits right in with hollywoods best effects and for good reason with oscarwinning visuals godzilla minus one is able to deliver one of the best stories of 2023 with a beautiful canvas in its presentation always thrilled to see the kaiju genre be used so masterfully

i never expected even to watch another godzilla movie but luckily i read some rave reviews and went this is one of the strongest recent movies from any country and it may be the greatest giant monster movie ever made in part because of the stellar special effects cinematography editing etc but mainly because you care deeply about the human charactersall of them including the nameless city dwellers who have to face destruction theres a strong sense of tragedy that is right up front and really makes you love the characters even the ones who seem at first to have been crushed by the war they recover in moving ways theres a moment early on when an embittered neighbor lady who has lost everyone in her family suddenly makes a decision to help an orphaned baby and the young mother who has taken her in it sounds cheesy but the actors make it work really well at that point i realized this might be something special and it keeps getting better and more gripping from there theres another moment where a major character gets swept away as if she were nothing that made me sob loudly  in a theater for the first time in years great psychological depth throughout and politically interesting in that its disillusioned heroes are striving toward a different form of heroism than the fascist wartime version of heroism as selfdestruction  if you want to see a convincing movie about the power of hope watch this plus its got the best little crying girl in movie history

godzilla minus one is unequivocally and truly a cinematic triumph  with a 15 million dollar budget we received a film with emotional depth meandering characterization beautiful visuals and a masterpiece addressing significant themes of survivors guilt ptsd shame and the human condition      i am blown away simply by how this can be one of the best action films of the year perhaps the best godzilla film ever put to screen yet have me invested emotionally in so many of the characters in typical fashion this is not normally the case    after reading and hearing all the hype for this film i did want it to be in my top 10 of 2023 but i dont think by no fault of the filmmakers that this is necessarily a movie that resonates with me  and full transparency perhaps my viewing experience and personal feelings towards the film may have been elevated if id watched it in a theatre with an audience     nevertheless this is hopefully a wake up call for hollywood great films can be made with amazing visuals and an encompassing narrative without the 200 million dollar price tag attached

i never thought i would walk away from 2023 with godzilla minus one in the top 3 best movies of the year but here we are and im still mad that it wasnt nominated for best picture  then again the awards never made sense anyway nor have they ever mattered in decades    one of the many things that has been missing from the godzilla films especially the ones made in the usa are likable characters we want to see survive  and this movie delivers that missing ingredient along with great directing writing and acting  despite the film being in japanese i was able to understand and become invested in the lives of these characters in a postwwii setting of japan  the main character has an arc that is in connection to godzilla and its done very well    speaking of which godzilla himself makes a return to his roots as just being a monster of destruction a true animal of nature on a bigger scale  in what appears to be a mixing of previous films interpretation on the king of monsters origins godzilla is an ancient creature that mutates due to the radiation of the nuclear bombs dropped in japan  so its a mix of mother nature and manmade  and the best part is that they made godzilla scary again  which in turn makes you want to see the characters survive and win against the giant monster that is tearing apart their new lives that have been built from the ashes of a world war    theres only a few flaws to speak of  some of the cgi isnt that good although when it is good its really good  theres a few edit choices that felt weird and some moments of dialogue that didnt feel right but theyre very few and far between  aside from that its a very solid film    in all honesty this just might be the best godzilla film ever made  it has emotional weight a terrifying godzilla interesting and likable characters and just an enjoyable experience

i am a huge godzilla fan  this was the best godzilla movie that has been made so far  normally when i am watching these movies i dont feel like the plot line is very strong  so i really enjoy the monster fighting although it seems as though while the monsters are fighting we are cutting away to the human characters talking about   some inane thing  this story was engaging enough that you didnt really miss that godzilla wasnt in the movie constantly

leave it to japan to totally outdo hollywood at their very own game with a fraction of the budget one would normally get for something of this magnitude and scale simply put the best godzilla movie to date awesome visuals and a thoroughly engrossing storyline with human characters you actually care about something i couldnt say the same thing about with apple tv pluses monarch legacy of monsters in my opinion    as mentioned the characters and story were true standouts and godzilla was portrayed as the most fierce and menacing monster ive ever seen before onscreen through so many films over the years when this monster is walking you genuinely feel the tremendous impact with every footstep taken    loved the character arc for the lead actor and for those not familiar with why this total was chosen its done with reference to japan being characterized at level zero in terms of the state of fragility with this country following the conclusion of world war 2 and with this new ever menacing threat its now a step below this    great actions sequences and a feelgood movie that delivers in spades superbly crafted the director takashi yamazaki has said he will take his time as far as coming up with a great sequel and im completely fine with this take all the time you need if it means something similar here can be redone with new aspects     loved some of the careful and proper nods paid by the director to classic thriller movies before this like jaws for one extremely well done

absolute masterpiece  the storytelling in this movie was amazing and it tugs on the heart strings throughout  you would expect that a movie barely featuring godzilla wouldnt really entice fans of the series but the monster is so well done and its rare appearances so spectacular that youre just waiting with bated breath until the next time he does pop up on the screen  godzilla was always intended as a cautionary tale about the danger of nuclear weaponry and this movie returns to the series roots in glorious fashion  they did a tremendous job of conveying the raw destructive power of godzilla but do yourself a favor and see this in theaters so you can truly experience it in all its glory  my only complaint is that they changed godzillas iconic roar

godzila minus one was amazing before i watched it i thought it being in japanese would be bad but the subtitles were very good and easy to read the movie doesnt have the most diolauge so i dont mind it the cgi wasnt the best at times but it still looked amazing the ending was okay but it could have been a bit better the sfx were amazing and the movie all around was fanominal and i would highly recomend watching it the progression of the main charecter was great and it was an all around great story

godzilla minus one proves just how solid direction and a darker tone on a character as old as him can still be entertaining and thrilling after all these years    the movie exceeds in its visuals and atmosphere to sell you on the setting of a postwar japan which is now under threat of a greater evil when godzilla is on the screen the scenes are great theyre engaging and tense which is exactly what you want with a movie like this alongside with a set of characters with some decently good performances to boot    where this movie lacks is the character development being quite minimal for everyone besides the central character this isnt an automatic issue but these additional side characters felt more like props to the main character rather than individuals with their own morales and personalities it comes across as the movie as a whole contains only 3 characters shikishima the main character the side characters and godzilla    godzilla just being a force of nature with a clear murderous intent to cause death and destruction everywhere he goes its shallow but works for the style of character he plays in the movie and the side characters play nothing more than the prop that pushes shikishima forward theres some small exceptions to this but theyre never shown more than a few minutes of screentime and automatically conclude with blending into the same formula everyone else plays into its extremely jarring how lacking these side characters feel when we get so many scenes around them     this added onto how predictable and clich√© the movie ends if you knew how it was going to end when watching you were likely correct it doesnt ruin the experience and ill happily rewatch it when it gets posted on streaming or a physical copy release however the movie had so much potential to be so much more yet ended up being a pretty inoffensive and by the books movie    one which im happy people enjoy but i think after almost 70 years we deserve so much better

a story about love loss  redemption you wouldnt think id be talking about a godzilla movie but indeed we are godzilla returns and this time hes menacing terrifying and absolutely unstoppable an extraordinary film that taps into the heart of what it means to be courageous in our darkest hour extremely well developed characters that take us on this journey often times forgetting were watching a godzilla movie incredible scenes of destruction balanced with an emotional story and unforgettable characters

godzilla minus one is an unexpectedly amazing film with deep character and story development while you want to see godzilla decimate cities and wreak havoc those types of scenes are used sparingly in minus one however when godzilla makes appearances  it has maximum impact less is definitely more the human characters and stories are the heart of this film which truly make it stand out it is a story of survival rebuilding gaining hope and losing hope it is also a movie about ptsd relationships and camaraderie and altruism godzilla just happens to be the antagonist and an excellent one at that go see it even if youre not a monster moviegodzilla fan you will not be disappointed unless you have absolutely no empathy or feelings the acting character development and story are that damn good with a budget of 15 million this movie easily equals and easily surpasses many hollywood blockbusters with 200 million dollar budgets or more

shikishima a failed kamikaze pilot struggles to come to terms with his cowardice and building a life in bomb damaged tokyo   godzilla doesnt help    this is what ive wanted every time they announced a new godzilla film   and they always failed me   the series of silly heroic godzilla films of the 60s and 70s were entertaining as a kid but when i was older i realized what a quality film the original was    this film honors that initial portrayal and instead of giving us lackluster humans we dont care about such as in the recent us films we are given sincere portrayals representing citizens and soldiers to which we can relate   found family  survivors guilt   hope  redemption  these themes are explored in such a way we are made part of the characters journeys      highly recommended    there is a mid credits scene

not only is godzilla minus one a spectacular monster movie but it also manages to cross genres and give us an excellent world war ii movie told from the perspective of characters grappling with the aftermath of wwii over the course of the story they struggle to find their place during the period of japanese reconstruction how can life ever return to some semblance of normal with cities in ruins families destroyed and a new threat already on the horizon the story is heartfelt and surprisingly moving by the end you care so much for the lives of the characters lending refreshing gravity to the threat of the monster this is my favorite movie of 2023 by a long shot highly recommend checking it out

this throwback to the origins of the gojira legend leaves every hollywood version in the radioactive dust  cloverfield is the only american monster movie that comes close in terms of emotional resonance but even that relied heavily on narrative gimmickry  what makes godzilla minus one stand out so much is good old fashioned storytelling while it takes its time establishing its characters and setting it never drags due to the standard of writing and acting this milieu of people eking out an existence in postwar tokyo is interesting enough without a monster attack so when the carnage does start we genuinely care about these characters  if only hollywood could put away their dei manuals and concentrate on good writing like this the cineplexes wouldnt be clogged with so many empty spectacles

as someone who despises the godzilla films of legendary from the past few years this was refreshing as heck the humans actually feel important and they make actually logical decisions on how to handle said kaiju and have proper character development the writing in monsterverse was abnormally stupid i must admit they had a kaijudestroying bomb but they preferred to abduct kong from his natural habitat and destroyed a whole city like what but its good to see that the humans here actually seem like theyre doing what they can as they learn about godzilla and the postwar storyline behind the movie was done very well the only downside to this movie would be that godzilla as a cgi monster had very blocky movements at points when the shots were afar and the water cgi was also a bit meh but to be fair its budget was 15m which is especially impressive since godzilla vs kong was literally 10x that much and it was pretty bad

godzilla minus one was such a wonderful surprise of a movie i went with my 13 year old twin boys and even they loved the emotional storyline and the suspense in addition to godzilla destroying things which is really what they came to see the subtitles did not get in the way of enjoying this movie you didnt even notice it because the acting story and action were just so captivating i also thought that the innovative and scientific way they came up with trying to defeat godzilla was so refreshing and a welcome intellectual departure from just using guns and bombs which is typically what you see with monster movies you will not be disappointed and the orchestral classical musical score was so outstanding its what made the suspenseful parts suspenseful and was the perfect complement to the magnitude of this movie the score was even something you would want to listen to on its own hands down the best movie ive seen in a long time and unquestionably the best movie of the year bravo godzilla minus one bravo

the first godzilla movie from 1954 depicts a postwar japan devastated by war and nuclear bombs  godzilla minus one takes place mostly in the late 1940s japan and plays on the same theme in fact minus one borrows heavily from the early godzilla movies and its great    the protagonist k≈çichi shikishima played by ryunosuke kamiki is ridden with survivors guilt hes kind of mopey and somewhat dislikable it begs the question of whether we as an audience should appreciate his yearning for a heroic sacrifice on the other hand the movies heartwarming qualities comes from the supporting cast humanizing the victims of this new threat    beyond its visuals themes and great soundtrack godzilla minus one managed something amazing it rejects traditionalistic values and brilliantly exclude any involvement from the military or the government from the problem solving     most definitely one the best movie in the franchise if not of the whole genre

this was arguably the most predictable movie ive ever seen halfway through the movie i could tell you exactly how it was going to end and knowing how it was going to end made the lead up to the final scene a complete slog they spent way too much time building up to a climax that everyone in the theater knew was coming its like the script was written by an ai who had spent the last 10 years learning all the action movie cliches i had really high hopes and walked out feeling like i had wasted two hours seeing a movie id already seen a hundred times before

as a fan of the monsterverse films this is everything that i have been missing and so much more going into it i knew the godzilla aspect of the film would be wonderful but the emotional depth and tone of the story made for such a captivating film my only problem with this sort of film is the redundant nature of making up a new way to kill godzilla and godzilla being able to withstand it with that being said it was better that the film was mainly human character development led the interconnectivity between the visuals and the story made for a smooth 2 hour runtime that keeps you entertained the whole time moreover the fact that the film was created with just 15 million is absolutely insane and you could tell so much effortwork was put into the final product to create an enjoyable fan experience basically it was a lot more meaningfulheavy in terms of subject matter than i was expecting it to be and im ashamed i waited so long to see it

godzilla minus one a thrilling cinematic experience    godzilla minus one is an exhilarating cinematic journey that captivates audiences with its stunning visuals powerful storytelling and mesmerizing action sequences as a devoted fan of the godzilla franchise i was thrilled to witness this latest installment that takes the beloved giant monster saga to new heights    what sets godzilla minus one apart is its ability to balance the aweinspiring spectacle of colossal battles with a poignant and compelling narrative the filmmakers have masterfully crafted a storyline that not only showcases epic showdowns between largerthanlife creatures but also delves into the emotional depth of the characters involved    the special effects in this film are nothing short of phenomenal the cgi work is seamlessly integrated bringing the monstrous creatures to life in a breathtakingly realistic manner every clash roar and destruction scene is delivered with such detail and grandeur that it immerses the audience in the heart of the action    furthermore the casts performances are commendable with each actor bringing authenticity and depth to their respective roles the human element in the film is as crucial as the giant creatures themselves adding layers of emotion and empathy that resonate throughout the storyline    the pacing of godzilla minus one is another aspect worth praising the movie keeps you on the edge of your seat from start to finish delivering adrenalinepumping sequences while also allowing moments of quiet reflection creating a perfect balance between excitement and contemplation    i also appreciate how the film pays homage to the classic godzilla legacy while infusing fresh and innovative elements into the narrative its a testament to the filmmakers dedication to honoring the franchises roots while offering something new and captivating for both longtime fans and newcomers alike    in conclusion godzilla minus one is a triumphant addition to the godzilla series that exceeds expectations on multiple fronts with its remarkable visuals engaging storyline and heartfelt performances its a mustwatch for anyone seeking a thrilling cinematic experience whether youre a diehard fan of the franchise or simply a lover of epic monster movies this film delivers on all fronts and leaves a lasting impression that wont soon be forgotten

this is not a godzilla film in the way i think most people will assume it to be it is an examination of grief sacrifice and perseverance in the years immediately following the devastation experienced in post wwii japan and godzilla     thats absolutely a reductionist view of the titular monster he is the physical representation of the evil of man that would bring about such devastation against whom the humans must defeat for hope not only in survival but in a better world to possibly be restored     ok that might be too lofty a description also but frankly its hard to find the words to accurately describe this film and all that it achieved i am not a godzilla fan ive seen the newer ones and theyre ok the idea of a giant ramping monster especially once it starts fighting other rampaging monsters always sounded silly to me i understand its origins were born in making sense of the horrors of the atomic bomb and fears for humanity after its creation but mostly its appeal has been extremely limited for me especially after 1998 im sorry but ew     but     godzilla minus one is just a good fing film i cannot say enough good things about it it is 100000 worth paying to see in the theater and theres just not a lot of movies out these days that you can really say that for it truly deserves more than just an oscar for best vfx which it has been nominated for writing directing cinematographyart direction best actor and yes best film     go see it in theaters now while you can

as a native japanese this movie is awesome and this is my first godzilla movie  i watched this movie at a movie theater and i was so happy to see that audience in the theater clapped loudly at the end of the movie  it shows the historical context very well such as the chaos struggles and emotional wounds volatility and slow recovery after ww2 i was also amazed that the movie shows detailed historical object such as japanese fighter plane zero and shinden and japanese cruiser takao  i am very glad that they choose the era that original godzilla was born rather than choosing modern world my image to godzilla movie in the past was just panic and fighting with godzilla wo message or story behind  but this movie gave us the emotional message and story of peoples pain and strength i highly recommend this movie to both who watched and never watched previous godzilla movie

godzilla minus one tells an intriguing and at times heart wrenching human story set to the backdrop of early post world war ii the monster itself delivers all the punch you would hope for as a modern version of the classic godzilla we know and love every scene is a work of art a bit of humor is interspersed to keep the mood from trending to dark i usually hate cgi but found the effects in this movie felt more practical than computer generated this wild ride is what going to the movies is all about

i havent been to the cinema since 2018 and there hasnt been a single film ive been enticed to see in all that time hollywood is and has been dead to me    but then godzilla rumbles into town and shows me that cinema isnt dead  its just moved hq  this movie was spectacular  and im not talking just about visual effects which are pretty much a given in this day in age the story is tight compelling  wastes no time and yet breathes with incredible ease letting you get to know the characters without any hamfisted plot dumps its not possible to watch this movie without tearing up even just a little you will get a lump in your throat and you will be grateful for it    im not particularly into godzilla or monster flicks in general  but i have to say i am grateful to some friends who convinced me to go and see this film i had seen reviews of it saying it was brilliant so i was sure it would be an enjoyable film  but seeing is believing this film absolutely deserves a 100 rating  and its very heartening to see it get 98 from both the professional cretins critics and audience alike    so bravo to toho studios  you guys knocked it out of the park

i have never had such a powerful experience in a theater immediately engaging and every moment is potent until the last credit leaves the screen did not know me and my wife would be crying tears throughout for a godzilla movie this is maybe the most important movie to come out in my lifetime as a descendant of japanese people who endured wwii it was a deeply moving and overwhelmingly spiritual experience i will never be the same    please go and see this movie in theaters if you can

i was genuinely having a hard time believing the good reviews this movie was getting and keep in mind this is coming from a hardcore godzilla fan so i was hearing a lot about this movie ever since it released and i finally came to watch it tonight and i have to admit i was worried it was going to be a disappointment however now having sat through the whole film i can safely say it was quite the opposite of that from beginning to end i was hooked thats something i never get from one of these movies like i mentioned before im a fan of these monster flicks but ive never given a monster movie a good rating only because im biased towards it this changed everything  i dont even know where to start the beginning sequence the ending sequence the family dynamic the score the vfx the main character and of course godzilla himself i actually care about the characters here and it was heartwarming seeing this disjointed family come together some might find this all a bit slow but personally i was invested i was never left wondering when the next godzilla scene will take place and of course we have to talk about that godzilla in this movie is just wow he was not there to play games he was not there to save the world against some worldending threat he was just a monster there to cause destruction and make the characters we know suffer legitimately this was the only time i remember wanting the humans to win and not the big old kaiju there might be mixed feelings on his screen time though some say hes got plenty to offer while others say hes in it too little my take is that if you take the term screentime literally then yes that lacks a bit here but the thing is he always feels like a threat you can feel his presence hes just lurking in the ocean waiting for the next time to strike and when he does come on screen my god he is terrifying and you will not be disappointed even if its a brief scene  many of us can agree he is more of a side character which i can imagine a few people getting upset about but what about the center of the story the main character shikishima is a failed kamikaze pilot he deals with survivors guilt and has trouble coming to the realization hes even alive hes convinced he died back in the war and his newfound life was just his last dream im not going to spoil anything but his character felt very complete and well written his character development was straight up beautiful the other stars of the show are a little girl her adoptive mother and a minesweeper crew they all have their good moments and have a lot of heart and personality to them   this movie also has a very good score it has hope it has fear its haunting its grandiose and of course classical the original godzilla theme is of course used in the film it is remastered but it still keeps the feel and terror of the 1954 suite  this movie cost less than 15 million dollars look what they did with that money the average monsterverse movie costs around 200 million dollars look what they did with that money the fact that the cgi cost just a mere fraction of a hollywood movie and looks just as good if not better than one is mindblowing there are just shots where you are staring at godzilla and his imposing figure it really is mesmerizing this should be the standard for modern movies  so in my conclusion this is my personal favorite godzilla movie by far its a beautiful story that you will get lost in i can only really see one small flaw with it and thats how it is a bit overacted in some parts but the more i think about this movie the more i appreciate it its almost perfect i came out of the theater only a couple of hours ago and i already feel like seeing it again i can see myself rewatching this over and over again for years to come and this review is not biased at all i am giving my true and honest opinion you will probably have a good time watching this movie even if you are not into kaiju movies if you are into the goofy more dumb fun monster flicks i cant guarantee youll like this film as much as others and i have if you like more grounded serious but still lighthearted movies i highly recommend it go see it before it leaves theaters im honestly very happy i got to see it on the big screen because it truly was a big experience im so happy about this films success and i can only imagine how embarrassed hollywood is right now they really need to wake up

in short minus one is my favorite movie of the year and possibly the best godzilla movie i have seen     it does a fantastic job of creating characters that actually feel real and meaningful to the story where previous godzilla movies have often had shallow or underwhelming characters that serve to bridge the gaps between scenes where the titular monster is on screen minus one has established a set of characters that genuinely feel like the primary focal point of the film the characters are wellwritten and feel so legitimately human that they steal the show from godzilla  something that works wonders for the pacing and narrative of the movie and makes godzillas actions feel much more meaningful     in addition the visual effects of the movie feel phenomenal godzilla movies have a history of requiring some considerable suspension of disbelief to make the monsters feel real this is a trend that i expected to see carried on into minus one especially with its incredibly small budget however the look of the movie is nothing short of phenomenal i never felt like the movie was ever cutting corners or trying to keep its effects within budget the shots of godzilla and the general feel of the movie as a whole feel very similar to the original godzilla but put together in a way that holds up to the modern cinema standards     all together i personally feel like this is the best movie ive seen this year and highly recommend anybody  not just godzilla fans  to watch this entry into the series

i have given this a top rating and like all reviews it is entirely subjective but i would like to offer some context first     as a genxr i have grown disillusioned with movies over the past decade at least to the point where until seeing this film i havent been to the cinema for over six years i know there has been good films out there over but having seen so many underwhelming movies over the years i have turned to apathy due to fear of being let down again and just not bothered     i had heard a lot of positive things about godzilla minus one as a fan of japanese entertainment and had decided to give it a chance once it was released here in the uk but when it did i had got cold feet and decided not to bother however i had went to the cinema the other day to see this on an impulse and was blown away by it     im not going to do a indepth review of this movie as other people have done such a better job but i want to describe my feelings about this why i had given it such a high rating and why i have renewed faith in blockbusters now     it is simple that at the heart of this film is not a monster going on a rampage but a disaster movie where a group of people are thrust into the destruction and mayhem caused by this monster and do their best to survive it     as the film focuses on the characters rather than overblown cgi and action sequences i was sucked into the world of these characters their fears their problems and yes their hopes for survival and it made me care for them  and become overcome by their emotional struggles     sure some of the heart string pulling has been done plenty of times before and parts of it is corny but the story is so strong the direction brilliant and the acting amazing that it didnt bother me and i let myself get carried along on the whirlwind of emotions that the film threw at me     as i had mentioned at the start this is purely subjective and  if this film had come out at a time where the overall quality of movies is more superior as to what it is now the film may not have had the same effect on me but it isnt and because of this i feel justified in giving it such a high rating     i know people may be put of because it is a monster movie but i had said it is more than that and is highly recommended to watch

godzilla minus one is a standalone godzilla movie from japan it brings the franchise back to its roots where godzilla is a monstrous force of nature an allegory of war while i do love the western monsterverse franchise it is mostly for seeing godzilla or kong fight another giant monster the writing and characters have never been a highlight in that universe does godzilla minus one deliver more than the monsterverse    firstly godzillas design is spectacularly frightening his roar is menacing and his heat rays are some of the best and most impactful blasts ive seen from godzilla every godzilla action set piece is terrifying and tense i love how these sequences are filmed from a human perspective so we get to truly see the scale and how dangerous godzilla is the music score by naoki sato is phenomenal his subtle orchestral score compliments the scene and illustrates the pain and struggles that japanese people in ww2 went through he then uses a strong powerful orchestral score for godzilla to show how he is bringing back the pain again his use of the godzilla theme is effective every time the visuals and cinematography look great while the cgi can be a bit wonky sometimes for the most part it looks good especially for godzilla who looks awesome it is honestly astounding how good this film looks for a movie under a 15 million budget    what this film succeeds at in comparison to western godzilla movies is having compelling human characters that you truly care about the characters are all suffering in some way from world war 2 whether it is ptsd or loss youre watching these characters try to overcome and push through this dark period the camaraderie and family dynamic is at the core of all the characters and it is extremely touching to watch i was especially rooting for the main character to get development just because i wanted to see him be happy that is why for the first time i was rooting for godzilla to lose as i didnt want to see our characters get hurt i also love how the story doesnt shy away from the negative aspects of japans government during ww2 the human drama is wonderfully engaging and can even tug at the emotional strings which is such an achievement in a godzilla movie    overall godzilla minus one is not only a terrific godzilla movie its an amazing movie period this movie shows that you can tell a great story with great characters and still have godzilla as a major element not only that you can still make a great looking movie with good cgi on a low budget the cg in this movie looks better than a lot of these western movies with 200 or 300 million budgets godzilla minus one is must watch and i highly recommend going to a theatre near you to experience it in all its glory

godzilla minus one is quite simply the best godzilla movie to date it handles the same themes as the 1954 original but better this film addresses the human cost of war defeat and tragedy with a level of passion and honesty that the original was simply not allowed to

a japanese historical wwii drama which happens to feature a giant lizard  the plot plays out as expected but has a more traditional style focusing on the characters as they struggle to deal with the aftermath of the war and a new threat of the giant monster  cultural issues such as the virtues of honor and survivors guilt are well portrayed by the varied cast of characters but it does make it a bit slow to get going and some scenes felt labored  godzilla itself looks impressively menacing and the special effects and scale of destruction invokes shock and awe  great use of music and an emotional ending even if it was a bit too happy

one of the best movies of 2023 and probably the best godzilla film learning more about godzillas origins symbolism and his past representations has made me love this film even more if i had seen all of the godzilla movies i believe that this would still be on top this movie doesnt even feel like a godzilla movie it feels like an interpersonal drama featuring godzilla it has some of the most beautiful gripping and heart reaching characterrelationship development that i have ever seen and it truly drives the movie it is the strongest part of the movie yet it doesnt sacrifice the quality of the action godzillas presence alone is the most menacing and intimidating i  have ever seen it and his destruction is unparalleled making him the first godzilla to actually scare me from the little that i have learned about godzilla movies this truly feels like it does justice to the monsters original purpose and symbolism his shear viciousness and relentless power is chilling and this paired with the next level character development achieves something that no other action movie has for me it made me truly worry for the main characters lives the only criticisms that i could barely conceive would be that it is very corny and on the nose with a lot of its dialogue but its a godzilla movie so that is expected and some could argue that there are some slight pacing issues but overall the pace feels very fluid and the 2 hour run time suits the movie perfectly i will forever be astounded that this movie was executed with a 15 million dollar budget especially because godzilla vs kong the last godzilla movie to come out had 140 million dollars more to work with and it still wasnt as good in my opinion go see this movie on my second watch it was sad to see that there were only two other people in the theater give this movie the love it deserves you will not regret it

easily the best film ive seen all year id seen the trailer which looked great and then heard all the good reviews for it on youtube and the internet so i decided to watch it if and when it was released here     it was brilliant its more accurate to call this a film with godzilla in it rather than a godzilla film with side stories its more about the healing and redemption after the trauma of war and loss the importance of being part of something whether its your family your crew or the taskforce     the acting is great you feel for these people and want to see some sort of happy ending for them and instead of cheering godzilla on this time you want the big guy to lose    the actions scenes are epic whether is the first attack on their boat to the final battle the ginza scene is particularly jaw dropping the special effects were for the budget absolutely top notch its hard to believe a film like this was made for only 15million especially when you consider how bad some of the multimillion dollar flops like the marvels or the the flash looked and they cost nearly 20 times as much    watch this film you will not regret it my film of the year easily

a visual feast that lacks emotional depth and strong character development godzilla minus one forgets the cardinal rule show dont tell as the film develops its characters mostly through dialogue excessive exposition nullifies the impact of emotional moments since the audience is told the emotional state of a character instead of showing us through the actions of a character or through dialogue with subtext nevertheless the eponymous godzilla is beautifully realized through stunning effects and creative cinematography if you prefer the power of western storytelling the plot may not grab your attention but the wellchoreographed action and destructive capabilities of godzilla will keep you somewhat engaged

i am a lifelong godzilla fan ive seen every single godzilla movie watched them all in order literally written a thesis about godzilla for my degree and did presentations on the franchise to say i love this franchise is an understatement     this this is the best godzilla movie that has ever been made ever this movie is amazing it has everything youd expect from a godzilla movie it isnt godzilla if it doesnt have a little bit of ridiculousness and cheesiness which i loved to see however it goes so much deeper the human story was moving and unexpected showed the real side of ptsd and loss and actually made me cry more than once i dont cry at movies the animation of godzilla is phenomenal and the new effect of his nuclear breath was shocking intimidating and incredible 2023 finally allowed for a serious godzilla movie that does godzilla his power his terror his majesty his destruction and his horror all true justice having such a fantastic and moving human story only elevated this movie more     my review does this movie no justice none at all it is now my favorite movie of my life thank you japan for making and sharing such an incredible story with us this is how godzilla was always meant to be perfection

scripted with creativity and heart taking place in beautiful scenery and sets engagingly shot and accompanied by a phenomenally dreadful and energetic score this addition to the franchise delivers lots of moving movements in the storyline as well as drastic action and tension as soon as the infamous lizard himself steps onto the scene ry√ªnosuke kamikis performance is shockingly touching especially during his emotional outbreaks while godzilla is designed and written in a successfully horrifying way the movie starts with a surprisingly strong scene starring a truly scary juvenile godzilla and a cast that reacts to him accordingly in authentic panic the characters are interestingly written especially the protagonist and mostly well casted including sakura and√¥ which was a smart choice for her role godzillas writing and design is terrifyingly crafted sharing some similarities with the ones from the older movies the atomic breath and following explosion scenes are intense theatrical feasts with its sound design and visuals even though there are such great qualities to offer there are some disappointments as well a scene which seems to be some sort of an american broadcast with a montage of clips felt really out of place and totally unnecessary adding nothing new or interesting to the plot which the audience didnt know already there is also another montage including the main characters passing some time together which could have been handled better with a tone that would have fit the rest of the movie and a better soundtrack now coming to the obvious the movement animations on the fully grown godzilla are too often stiff and puppetlike when he doesnt attack or swim one scene in particular stuck with me in which the hero flies his plane into the monsters mouth however godzilla stays completely frozen and motionless even with the massive impact thats a bit of letdown but it essentially doesnt ruin the authenticity of the monster the effects and the rest of the production are absolutely impressive for the budget of only 15m nonetheless

recently a friends wild enthusiasm drove him to embark on an 8hour journey to catch a movie whether hes a diehard franchise fan or just slightly eccentric i couldnt resist the intrigue the film in question godzilla minus one was slated for a limited release in select theaters and my friend insisted it was a cinematic gem    returning from his trip he couldnt stop praising this 15 millionbudget marvel claiming it outshone its predecessors intrigued i joined a group of nine for a screening only 2hours from home the following weekend despite the theater being less than ideal the films magnetic pull kept me glued to my seat for the entire two hours    this unexpected gem didnt rely entirely on explosive special effects instead it unfolded as a gripping narrative a rare throwback to when stories took precedence the action though loud and at times comical seamlessly wove into the tale of overcoming adversity godzilla minus one became a story about hitting rock bottom descending even further and then summoning the will to rise again    my friends insistence that godzilla symbolizes more than a monstrous entity proved accurate godzilla is a metaphor for any catastrophic event encouraging me to focus on character dynamics rather than awaiting destruction i found myself emotionally invested shedding a few tears along the way i wasnt the only one    whether or not youre a godzilla enthusiast godzilla minus one deserves the acclaim its garnered take a chance the worstcase scenario is ten bucks out of pocket and a couple hours of your time at best youll find yourself labouring over the right words for your first ever review compelled to share the magic    chris yuill  godzilla minus one 2023  55    edit the film is now showing in my hometown 12 of us watched it last night it was even better than the first time and only 15 minutes from home

what an absolute delight godzilla minus one is one of the hits of 2023 so far at its heart it truly is a classic godzilla movie from the godzilla walk and its classic backing track however its the story between the makeshift family that stars as the movies true heart and soul of the movie the connection between the characters and their history is so gripping and emotional to the point that its hard to not root for our main cast shikishimas story is one of tragedy yet hopefulness with so many plot points that were littered throughout the movie payed off in such powerful ways the character has his flaws which makes him more relatable and you feel the weight behind every decision he must make in the movie i love that we stayed focused on this makeshift family for the entirety of the film no side missions we are always following the next phase of the group i could ramble on for paragraphs about just how great this movie is thank you japan you have given us masterpiece in storytelling acting characterwork and dread an absolute piece of art

i was not expecting such a complete movie went in expecting a monster thriller left having seen a storytelling delight no doubt godzilla is gargantuan but he wasnt even the biggest part of this movie awesome film

dont believe the hype godzilla movies are not supposed to have deep character exploration   its ok  but really ok the premise is sound  worthy of exploration but in a godzilla movie no there were some gaping historical plot holes and its good enough for someone to tidy it up  get their history right like i say dont believe the hype pity

if you have ever seen a godzilla monster movie on tv as a kid you will surely love this homage from toho movies the drama the plan the plan b the plan b backup plan the wavyhaired scientist the stodgy naval captain the emotionallywracked failed kamikaze pilot the wartorn tokyo the wounded warriors volunteering one more time    there are no plot twists at all but man what a trip down memory lane just pure fun from beginning to end

fully perfectly and heart hittingly encapsulates the emotions and feelings of postwar japan to the point of at times forcing you to sit and think and really feel  brings a whole new view on the original meaning behind gojira as a character and pounds it into your face exactly the way it should be  my only gripe is the unexplained janky movement of godzilla at times almost like hes taking a page of out shins book but its very easy to overlook that considering the quality of the rest of the film  overall an absolute stunner of a film by far the best representation of tohos creation to date
great godzilla movie it had a great story and we get to see who is the ruler of all monsters

definitely a builder  first 20mins felt like a slowish japanese rehash of jurassic park island and all you know the bit where everyones fave trex dino turns up and starts eating folk one half at a time but slowly you do get to care about the lead character and the rest of the cast and then about half way it gets rather juicy   lots of stomping chomping and pointless merciless killing of innocent folks random ones and maybe even ones you like along with general giant monstering about and destruction nice satisfying ending  although not really anything unexpected  just jurassic park on steroids with an added heat ray but theres nothing wrong with that   better and certainly more satisfying than most of the other  more monied  studio offerings of late well worth watching despite having to tackle the subtitles which im usually one to avoid to be fair and honest the plot is not very complicated so you really dont need to read the subtitles too much  super catchy orchestrated da da da godzilla is coming style theme tune for sure stayed in my seat a bit longer for that at the end    i actually saw this on day of release in uk and i saw the shift before it just as i had some free time knowing what i know now if id only had time for one movie  id have actually picked the shift  although theres not too much in it i just found the shift more compelling overall

to be honest ive never been a fan of godzilla i wasnt very excited to go see this but i was won over within 10 minutes  i love a good story and that is exactly what this movie gives the characters were written so beautifully the acting is great the cgi is great the cinematography is stunning and godzilla is finally a creature that is capable of utter destruction   i think anyone can appreciate this film its very possibly the best movie of 2023

the best movie ive seen all year and will probably be better than anything coming out in the next year as well i came in expecting another fun but not so great big lizard movie but was pleasantly surprised by the greatness of this movie the movie left me speechless walking out of the theater the problem i always have with movies like this is they dont have meaningful characters and they become the main focus the characters in this movie are relatable and feel real the relationship between the main protagonist and godzilla shows the tenacity of humanity even when in the face of something devastating thats what makes this a good film is the writing and the overall story but it doesnt stop there godzilla in this is by far the greatest iteration of the character when i say it makes the humans seem doomed to fail its an understatement godzilla is a truly monstrous presence that seems to be unfazed by anything anyone can throw at it and thats leaving out the greatest part the atomic blast is amazing the most beautiful devastating and powerful atomic blast ever seen on screen the sound cuts out for a second before the blast hits and then you hear the explosion the suspense it creates even though you know what is coming keeps you on the edge of your seat this movie is amazing spending money on a movie in theaters is a waste of its not this one when it gets a digital release i will be the first one in line to buy it and same with a physical release of it gets one

this movie by far is the best godzilla movie ever and i believe this is the best movie of 2023   great story great cgi a overall great movie the sub titles really give you the feeling that you traveled across the ocean  just to go see the movie   i would be shocked if this movie does not get nominated for best picture   dont get me wrong oppenheimer in my opinion  is the odds on favorite to win best picture  that was until i have seen this   and for a 15 million dollar budget   wow the special effects look perfect  wow  the cgi looks flawless 15 million budget wow   director takashi yamazaki and toho productions did great  this movie is not only worth 5 stars  this movie is worth 5 excellent stars  great story line     toho productions and director   takashi yamazaki   make this masterpiece for just 15 million dollar budget wow very impressive and refreshing  i enjoyed this movie very much

wow this movie is very professionally made not something i would usually like but it is excellent it is also a very thinly veiled look into the soul of japan post wwii and the crazy radical nationalists who brought their country to ruin the producers largely stay away from pointless afterthefact commentary on the atomic bombs themselves and move to how japan found itself where it did in late 1945 but at the same time preserving the honor of the ordinary japanese people who were disgusted with where their fascist leaders took them with no one else to help the spirit of the japanese people rise to fight a real monster as opposed to the false enemy their nationalist government forced them to fight against in wwii an indictment against pointless selfsacrifice but deeply committed to giving everything you have to save others their community and their common welfare is a refreshing theme this movie says it is not about me its about us with refreshing honesty although tastefully done it is a warning about the rise of radical nationalism today especially in america this is an excellent movie for our time thoughtful respectful and deeply japanese plus the subtitles are easy to read for those who dont speak japanese

the first godzilla set the standard and minus one is essentially a remake of the original most remakes dont hold a candle to the original but this movie improves every plot hole and actually delivers on the terror that the original intended but couldnt quite reach because of special effects limitations when it was made in 1954 it also delivers more emotional impact from the characters and storyline and godzilla is in the film at a higher percentage of playtime than the original i imagine eiji tsuburaya is beaming with joy from the other side at how they brought his original vision to life like he intended it to be best godzilla movie and design to date

not to ostracize those who dont like this movie  but you have to be a troll poorly traveled or just not very smart to not be able to recognize how good this japanese film is  you will have to read the horror but the japanese dialogue and inflection is important to the emotion of the movie  its an challenging film about survival duty and loss with a big lizard  the sound is brilliant as well as the silence when needed  what they did with less than 15 million is unreal  this should serve as a wake up call to hollywood  we dont need your bloated expensive product anymore with poorly written characters no one cares about  how can han solo die and you dont care  answer the writing is just that bad they should have stayed on strike  foreign films are up to the challenge of entertaining us and not lecturing us about how bad we are as people

originally posted on letterboxd this is my third time watching this film and i i think this has literally become my favorite movie of all time    i love everything about this film how traditional it is in story telling    the elements of the films characters work so well    noriko as this element of balance and happiness within koichis life mr nobu as the wisely veteraned exmilitary specialist and the doc and kid as the kindly side characters one representing the old generation and the other kid representing the new generation both treated with respect    when godzilla arrives to threaten these characters you feel the weight of their terror largely thanks to director takashi yamazaki who wrote directed and led the vfx for the movie his incredible character writing is what elevates this film from being a good one to being a great one    this film isnt just good godzilla action this is just good storytelling    im about to dive into spoilers so fair warning    when noriko presumably dies everyone feels the weight of her death she wasnt just a throw away character i the plot you actually feel the weight of her death because the characters feel it and through the characters emotions koichi especially you can feel the air in the room be lost    this personalizes the fight between godzilla and koichi shikishima and what makes it so impactful hes not just fighting to redeem himself anymore hes fighting to protect what he still has left and hes even prepared to die for it    very heavy stuff    the ending of the film being happy and noriko turning out to be okay doesnt undo any of that and the way godzilla is defeated is both thematically satisfying and a book end to the story    hear me when i say that the battle between koichi shikishima and godzilla will go down in history as one of if not the most iconic moment in a godzilla film a david and goliath moment to inspire future generations    at the end of the day this film is absolutely worth your time and everyone who has seen it like you will all agree this is not just one of the best godzilla films ever made but one of the best kaiju films ever made and makes me hopeful for the future of cinema

this is finally the godzilla film id been hoping for after so many others had at best fallen short of what i felt was the proper treatment for this franchise or at worst missed the mark completely it strikes the difficult balance of achieving a competently compelling human plot and characters while still delivering on the high intensity action and spectacle that audiences crave from the genre     the use of godzilla as an allegory for the inescapable trauma and ptsd that completely engulfed the japanese population post wwii was perfectly woven in and in my opinion paid true homage to the very real human psychological origin and idea behind the creation of the monster itself     the cinematography and cgi work was very tastefully done and had far better visual impact onscreen than many other recent more heavily funded offerings in the genre proving that a budget is not necessarily a barrier to a true quality product for audiences    proving that its indeed very possible to make a seemingly one dimensional franchise break out of previous limitations i was overall refreshed and entertained by this entry and hope to see more from the director and studios responsible definitely a worthy offering that stands in contrast to todays current often abysmal menu of theatrical release fare

this was the best film i have seen in 2023 this is not simply a great godzilla movie but rather a great movie that happens to be a godzilla movie the writing was tight it was brilliantly acted a classic redemption story and very much a tear jerker for unexpected but all the right reasons parents take your kids to this movie this film perfectly and overtly reflects the values of heroism stead fastness overcoming incredible adversity and the power of the common man  bring the wife or girlfriend as the love story included within is hard to beat there is no where to find fault in this movieand thats rare  just a real triumph hollywood you need to take heed and gain the lessons spelled out by this movie that cost a paltry 15 million  to makebut has the production value of any film made for 10 times that  i am sooooo glad i made an effort to see this film on the big screen and its goes without saying that this film will find its way into the lionheart movie collection   whether or not you are a fan of godzilla go out and see this film while you still can in a movie theater you will thank me or kick yourself for missing out

i took my son to see this movie and honestly didnt know anything at all about it other than that it is a godzilla movie i was expecting a fairly mindless monster movie and was totally blown away by what this movie actually is the original godzilla movie interwove themes of the anxiety that japanese people felt over their defeat in wwii the fact that they were the only people to ever suffer an attack by an atomic weapon and the betrayal many people felt they had suffered at the hands of japanese leadership this movie forefronts all of that going back to what godzilla originally was godzilla the monster is central to the story as an implacable and allbut unstoppable force but the centerpiece is a very beautiful and occasionally sad human story for the first time in a long time godzilla the kaiju is actually scary the people seem very human and the story is absorbing

godzilla minus one  plus two subtract a fraction of eight    rating a    so anyway i kinda got on a bit of a japanese kick lately because i knew this new godzilla movie was coming out and i thought i never saw that last one toho made shin godzilla i suppose i should look that up it was only available on crunchyroll an anime streaming service for nerds im certainly not a nerd but they had a free one week trial  one week was plenty of time to watch just one godzilla movie and then cancel the anime channel no need to waste any more time there im not one of those weird anime people    after i finished shin godzilla i was like well ive still got like a week anyway maybe ill try some of these weirdo shows with talking bananas and purple hair just to see and then ill cancel it by the end of the week trial i had watched all kinds of random things from chainsaw man to sgt frog along with the oddly named that one time i got reincarnated as a slime and my favorite my hero academia i was literally in the middle of episode 36 when the trial went out and i was yelling at the tv to let me watch more of this asian crack  it didnt listen  it chided me  like that time at panda express when i asked for a large cup of orange sauce to go    so aside from now contemplating my hair color and life choices i watched shin godzilla from 2016  it was terrible  id rate it a d  the online description literally says in the film politicians struggle with bureaucratic red tape in order to deal with the sudden appearance of a giant monster that evolves whenever it is attacked     are you serious politicians struggle with bureaucratic red tape a godzilla film thats your opening statement  i dont know what they were thinking who wants to watch politicians do anything unless its slowly melting terminator 2 style into a lake of lava that film felt like they had to make it or theyd lose their rights to godzilla like foxs last fantastic four movie  a description for a godzilla film should be like in ancient shogun japan three wartorn ronin samurai seek revenge against the newly summoned demon beast godzilla who ravaged their master and village make him only like 30 feet tall and have all kinds of oni and supernatural things it shouldnt be godzilla is sued by the people of tokyo in this four hour courtroom drama although a godzilla courtroom drama does sound kinda cool now that i think about it  godzilla is up on the stand and the district attorney is grilling him over property damage and godzilla panics and eats him  then thats another charge against him so he charges up his bluegammablast and the judge tells him hes overruled  this just writes itself    so because of the horrible shin godzilla i was a bit hesitant to head out to godzilla minus one but i was bored and wanted to go to the theater and i have an unlimited pass and so i did  i was very glad i did  i enjoyed it a lot  for this 38th godzilla film they decided to go back to its roots  its set in the late 1940s just after wwii  its about a kamikaze pilot who ran from his duty  he battles his own demons as a result of this choice and has to find his way back to honor  this is the focus of the film  so you may be saying but i thought it was a godzilla film  i thought you mocked the other one for being about politicians  sure but this one made it interesting it was much more personal and a redemption story of a coward pilot is much better than twenty politicians debating whether to setup a special committee to investigate a possible monster attack  this was a character study with godzilla representing inner demons of humiliation and dishonor it worked for me  if they made a godzilla movie about me the beast would represent the regret of eating at taco bell for a month straight and what i did to my master bathroom    that said it wont work for everyone  it is japanese made not american made  it is all in japanese with english subtitles  it only had a 15 million budget  it is a period drama  it harkens back to the original 1954 godzilla film  if you are just looking for a big lizard kicking over skyscrapers this isnt the movie for you youre probably looking for godlizzo if you want a cool japanese film with a more deeply felt character arc that happens to be set around a big lizard destroying tokyo and the pacific then this is the film for you    i would recommend seeing it with the proper expectations in place  it was cool to see it on the big screen with godzilla huge and angry  the whole time i was wondering what the japanese people would have thought if this was the film shown in 1954 theaters  it would have been a pretty cool reaction    one of my favorite things was the integration of the original musical score into the godzilla scenes when that kicked in it made my heart smile  it was a fun time at the theater  ive seen around 12 of the 28 godzilla films and this was probably my favorite one

i was surprised to experience a heavyhitting emotional movie that also includes a monster with an atomic heat ray the focus of the story being immediately during the aftermath of wwii makes for a great origin story of godzilla alongside characters who are dealing with not only their country being destroyed but almost every aspect of their lives needing to be rebuilt theres a lot to unpack and quite a few themes that are tackled in a film where i thought i would just be witnessing a giant lizard monster flipping ships and knocking over buildings     there is a moment where everything goes silent and i cant remember the last time ive been in a crowded theater where it seemed the audience was holding their breath there were times of cheering clapping and im sure some tears being shed what more could you want my only complaint is despite ryunosuke kamiki appearing in a few dozen films but his ability to express realistic crying on screen is nearly nonexistent overall though im quite satisfied and will be enthusiastically recommending this to everyone

it has been over a week now that i have seen godzilla minus one and i am still thinking about it easily the best godzilla film ever made and ranks as one of the best disaster films ever made as well the storytelling was just spot on and kept you glued from beginning to end the movie looked amazing and it was on a 15mm budget unbelievable i cannot wait to see it again

i grew up in the 80s watching godzilla marathons whenever they came on tv which wasnt often but when they did you can bet i was glued to the tv most godzilla movies were campy made for kids so yeah we didnt care for the plot we just wanted to see giant monsters fighting the first scary godzilla movie that i watched was godzilla 1985 or as it was called in japan the return of godzilla g85 is a direct sequel to the original godzilla from 1954 and ignores all the movies from the 60s and 70s it returned godzilla to its roots where hes more of a force of nature not necessarily a hero or villain so it was a nice change of pace of what i had seen     having seen every godzilla movie from the showa and heisei eras and some from the millenium series i was longing for something more modern not just a man in a rubber suit godzilla 1998 was an utter disappointment so when wblegendary brought us an american godzilla that was closer to the original it was what we wanted growing up an updated godzilla with todays technology yes it was still a bit campy but the monsters looked great we didnt care about the human element we never have    thats what makes tohos godzilla minus one special theyve managed to make an amazing godzilla movie where we actually care about the humans were rooting for them all and dont want them to get killed by godzilla this movie will get you emotional im not crying you are the visuals the sounds and if you watch it in 4d oof even better ive watched it twice already and cant wait for it to be released digitally might even buy the dvdbluray whenever its released
this movie was fantastic the feel and vibe of the movie reminded me of my childhood while growing up watching godzilla movies  10 out of 10 highly recommend
must watch in 4d  feels like godzilla the ride worth it
an emotional tale of grief loss grit love and resolve set in post ww2 japan oh yeah it also has godzilla in it this movie rules
the human characters are actually engaging for once and godzilla himself is incredible

this is the godzilla movie many have been waiting and wishing for it forsakes the hollywood depiction of a saviour and goes allin on its traditional japanese roots of godzilla as an unstoppable force of nature given the budget usd15mil it is certainly amazing what the production company managed to pull off with both visual and practical effects godzilla looks a little janky at times  but it is by no means terrible   and the heatatomic breath this movie nailed it  if youre happy with reading subtitles or can speak japanese then i cant recommend this movie enough   i only hope modern hollywood takes a page out of this book on how to write a compelling story with interesting characters

i grew up with godzilla my dad putting the movie monster on our tv for family movie nights are memories ill cherish my appreciation for the monster only grew as a learned more about the backstory and why the original film was made i was so excited to see this film and brought a group with me some who have never seen a godzilla movie before and some who grew up with the monster like myself as i watched i looked at my friends faces they were all the same shocked and on the edge of the seats as they watched hands over their mouths as godzilla charges his atomic breath this movie is for everyone and a big win for fans who have been here from the start the film creates new fans and is a masterpiece to us gfans absolutely incredible 1010

how often do you watch a movie and it becomes an instant classic ive been a fan of godzilla for most my life introduced to the series by my dad godzilla has always been a series filled with campe fun monster fights and terrible human plots in a way that was the godzilla experience an uncut gem that was special but never succeeded at holding a narrative even the best movies in the series never rising above mediocre in story telling    but godzilla minus one it is the culmination of the entire godzilla franchise as if we had only been experiencing the prototypes of the truly worthy creation since 1954 godzilla minus one is the godzilla movie accept no american substitutions takashi yamazaki has bridged the gap that godzilla has been lacking for so long a delivered a truly wonderful story to go along with worlds favorite giant monster    i could not stress enough just how moving of a narrative it is and how unexpected and delighted i was watching it of the nearly 20 godzilla movies ive watched godzilla minus one is the only one that made me cry i realized in the theater that i wasnt just having a good time i wasnt just getting a thrill but i was truly moved by a godzilla movie that i wasnt putting up with the human plot to get to godzilla for once    if you havent yet go watch this movie i havent touched on the cinematography or the acting or music etc but it is easily some of the best in the franchise the sound design in particular is truly to be commended     takashi yamazaki is writer and director to a truly legendary film in godzilla minus one i am incredibly thankful to him and the many other that came together to make this movie my favorite godzilla movie and a truly great film
emotional action packed exactly what i anticipate from a great godzilla flick  if youre a fan of japanese kaiju films this one is a definite must see

godzilla is back baby ive been a fan of godzilla since i was a kid in the early 2000s and i can say that we havent gotten an exceptional new film since ive been alive looks like thats over now though the story of our boy shikishima the failed kamikaze pilot has to be the best human arc in a godzilla movie yet normally fans complain about the human stories being an annoyance but this time it nearly steals the show this is helped by the interesting setting of a battered japan immediately following their defeat in wwii the gman himself does not disappoint either i especially loved how they made his breath attack feel so powerful walked out of the theater with a big goofy grin on my face and come to find everyone else enjoyed it too hope this kindles new interest in the ip exceptional

maybe ive grown used to immersive games with good plots like the fallout series but i could only give this 35 stars i might be spoiled on movies because of immersive games    the plot was one of disgrace and redemption with a touch of exploration of ptsd so that was nice the special effects were quite good    but to me the ending was predictable and everything worked out in the end you know that sort of thing    on the whole it kept my interest and i wont say the movie was bad but for all the 5 star gushing reviews i guess i expected more    i will say keeping the movie in japanese and subtitling it actually added to the experience it felt far more authentic that way

surprisingly good i wasnt expecting to like this movie as much as i did especially considering its in japanese and i had to read subtitles  not that i really mind having to read subtitles but those movies dont tend to make my topmoviesoftheyear list if you know what i mean and really if it wasnt for my 12 year old nephew wanting to see it i probably would have missed it but glad i didnt    ive no doubt that some will complain about the movie being too long or not having enough godzilla action but what really made this one shine for me personally was the time spent on telling a good story and character development i really felt like the characters were the main focus here and godzilla was a secondary focus serving as a way to tell a story about honor and shame and redemption and so much more a great cast a way better than usual script for a godzilla movie beautiful cinematography and good special effects all helped make it work and when we do get to see godzilla wreaking carnage  it has even more impact because of the deep emotional impact we can see he has had on the lives of the characters    small personal quibbles not quite sure why godzilla had to be even fatter than what i used to refer to as the american godzilla from the 1998 film with matthew broderick and i wish he had ate more people instead of just biting them in half  but then he might have been even fatter lol

prepare to be blown away by this incredible film i too was skeptical when i first booked tickets for godzilla minus one the title alone seemed like a turn off and as someone who isnt a fan of excessive special effects i was hesitant to tell my husband about the movie in fear that he may also be put off by it    but let me tell you this movie surpassed all of my expectations despite its title which may sound unappealing at first glance the reviews raved about its brilliance so with an open mind and high hopes my husband and i sat down to watch    and boy were we blown away the story of japans devastation during world war ii and the terrifying presence of godzilla had us on the edge of our seats but what truly captivated us was the underlying love story and the courageous kamikaze pilot who fears death    this is not your typical monster movie filled with overthetop special effects instead it tastefully combines elements of 1940s nostalgia with 21st century technology to create a truly unique experience the attention to detail and commitment to staying true to the era is commendable and adds an extra layer of realism to the film    i cannot recommend this movie enough its not just a film you watch and forget about its one that stays with you long after the credits roll so dont miss out on this beautiful masterpiece that will leave you in awe hurry and grab your tickets now before theyre sold out

godzilla minus one should sweep the oscars and win the academy award for best picture      yes this is a foreign japanese film with english subtitles but  godzilla minus one is a stunning masterpiece that will leave you breathless if you give it a chance this gripping and heartfelt film takes us back to the aftermath of world war ii where the legendary monster wreaks havoc on a wartorn japan    the films exquisite cinematography captures the raw emotions of the characters and the sheer terror of godzillas presence the special effects are topnotch making the monsters appearance all the more terrifying and aweinspiring    one of the most striking aspects of the film is its exploration of the human condition in the face of overwhelming adversity the characters are complex and relatable and their struggles will resonate with audiences long after the credits roll    in short godzilla minus one is a mustsee film that is a masterclass in stunning visuals powerful storytelling and an unforgettable monster to create a truly unforgettable cinematic experience
