this is a really good movie and the best use of large scale action ive seen in a long time  way better than marvel other godzilla movies better than apocalypse movies godzilla is 200 feet tall but frightening  devestating on a human level and tightly bound to the inner struggles of the characters  there were times i said oh my god to the devestation or was really moved by the courage struggle or triumph of the characters    the writing  direction is the difference  in many movies of this scale you see cgi robots monsters or indestructible super heroes knocking over cgi skyscrapers from miles away  in this movie the writers put a 200 monster down at the level of people and theres geniune suspense  dread in the action  the shots of huge events like godzillas nuclear breath make you feel like youre inside it instead of 3 miles away       we really enjoyed this movie hopefully marvel  other studios take note and start producing gripping involving action movies that leverage cgi instead of what feels like a series of boring demo reels from computer animation studious

in a year full of insanely expensive shallow and forgettable hollywood blockbusters its so exciting to see one that doesnt skip out on the great characters impactful themes strong acting and sharp writing yes this movie has great godzilla action  the effects visuals audio and especially godzillas design are all impressive to the point that the movie is genuinely scary at times but the humanity behind this movie is its biggest strength thematically i loved what the film says about how we find meaning in our lives especially when tragedy strikes and we dont know where to go the family dynamic is excellent and the camaraderie among the minesweeper crew make this movie a joy to watch while koichis journey dealing with ptsd and survivors guilt give the movie a great emotional core even side characters like the youngest member of the minesweeper crew koichis neighbor and the mechanic have nuance    this movie is proof to me that audiences arent sick of blockbusters per se but theyre sick of bad mediocre and as i said earlier forgettable ones this is certainly not one of them and one of my favorites ive seen in a while

certainly an unexpected surprise  this is a story of redemption with loads of emotion  youll see ptsd guilt and grief during wartime  the character development here was off the charts terrific and arguably some of the best since yes the original star wars  there wasnt one character in this movie that you didnt have some emotion tied to really well done there      obviously this is a godzilla movie however this is more of a character developmental story of our main protagonist  this was really well done on all aspects    my lone holdup being a foreign movie was the language barrier however as long as you can read subtitles well the emotion and communication with each scene was not an issue    the story was great but if i can find one minor issue with the movie would be that it should have kept some decisions rather than potentially sequel baiting or keeping the emotion tied to specific characters more permanent  if you see it youll know what im talking about  elsewise if you can consider this a standalone movie this was great

there have been many versions of the godzilla mythology but in my opinion godzilla minus one is one of the best ive seen its a japaneselanguage film and its surprisingly explicit in its critique of various aspects of japans approach to its past history in wartime its commentary on war and nuclear power symbolised by the postwar emergence of godzilla is powerful and the themes of loss survival and hope add emotional depth    the story focuses primarily on sosaku tachibana a fighter pilot who has managed to avoid his fate as a kamikaze pilot by avoiding action altogether at one point in the film it is noticed that his plane hasnt been damaged the guilt of not fulfilling his orders including not defending his colleagues against godzilla early in the story haunts him and his internal struggles with this are constantly present as the story unfolds    the other characters are also welldeveloped and very relatable bringing a sense of stability in the middle of the chaos this adds a deeply human element to the story which focuses more on the humans than the action and special effects giving us a reason to empathise with and care about these characters rather than just seeking the thrills that come with this genre    having said that though the visual effects in godzilla minus one are stunning and bring godzilla a very intimidating monster to life with realism and fine detail and the action sequences are intense and exciting godzilla really feels powerful and destructive as it goes on its rampages    some viewers may find the plot a bit predictable but the godzilla mythology is wellembedded among many filmgoers so that may increase the sense of predictability and occasionally it is obvious that cgi has been used so there are moments when things seem a bit artificial and there is not much humour to lighten the relentless sadness and fear of the storyline    if you are a fan of monster movies and action films and especially of the godzilla story go and see godzilla minus one it delivers what it promises when it comes to spectacular visuals and intense action the explicit exploration of themes of war and loss is handled well

bit of a slow start imo but once you get through it and start to actually build attachment to the characters and their storylines you get engulfed in this thrilling plot that invokes a plethora of emotions from fear and sadness all the way to duty and patriotism a great execution that goes beyond the scope of its predecessors and touches on deep rooted topics of japanese 20th century culture and the effects that war had on both the mind and body of the country and its people havent sat on it for too long yet but as of right now it stands as my favorite rendition of the franchise ever

ive just returned home from my first viewing and i cant wait to share my thoughts the story follows a veteran of war as he overcomes survivors guilt and realizes through his found family and japans new struggle against godzilla his life has meaning and the importance of mankinds persistence in the face of adversity toho proves less is more by returning godzilla to his antagonistic roots as a standalone terror with its eyes set on japan no other monsters needed a worthy and wonderful franchise entry by writerdirector takashi yamazaki the film paves the way for a bright future of toho godzilla content the pacing of the film can be a little inconsistent at times however this hardly detracts from the glorious monster action and touching human storyline that make godzilla minus one one of the greatest entries in the franchise to date coming in at 3 on my list of all time favorite godzilla movies i happily give it a 455

this is easily the best film of the franchise and im hoping present and future screenwriters took notes    to make the title character not the star was a bold move but it paid off the storytelling of japan regrouping from wwii and the human condition is so phenomenal and compelling that at one point i forgot i was watching a godzilla movie but thats a toho for you    i cant wait for a sequel i need a sequel

the storytelling was actually amazing in this one scenes where beautiful and an amazing score would definitely recommend best godzilla film by far

even if you took the big guy out it would be an amazing period piece about immediate postwar japan 1945 to 1947 the original was set in 1954 after japan was starting to rebuild the devastation of tokyo and survivors guilt without excusing japans wartime actions and then they made godzilla the most horrifying hes ever been while scaling him back down to the original movie size hes not so big humans are beneath his notice he notices and absolutely hates them its an excellent drama its an excellent horror movie and its an excellent godzilla monster movie highly recommend
maybe best godzilla movie of the all one part kaiju one part ozu

what a great job by the screen writers   finally a monster movie where the monster is not buddies with some scientists or secretly in love with a human  king kong ice skating in central park was about as silly as it gets in any movie ever   the writers actually let a monster be scary and not have a soft spot for the puny humans  the story was also thought provoking as well given the history of japan for individual self sacrifice and questions about what a country should expect from the citizens  this is not just a movie for monster movie junkies  hollywood should take notes on how it should be done  one question  how did they make that little girl cry on cue   she is too young to take direction and those were some real tears  maybe i dont want to know

this is what movies should be a perfect blend between spectacle and story this is a film that not only takes godzilla back to his roots as a postwar allegory but expands upon those ideas in beautiful and unexpected ways godzilla minus one is such a compelling human drama that it would still be a fantastic movie without godzilla even being present and yet we are blessed with some of the most incredible and thrilling godzillamonster action we have seen to date after 5 viewings the film is still incredibly impactful and resonant i love it
best movie ive seen this year no one does godzilla better than toho

the best movie of the year by far felt like a teenager at the theatre again im probably going to watch it again this week bravo japan that was a masterpiece and its even more impressive it was so good despite a lower budget
excellent on par with shin godzilla a must see for die hard kaiju fans
it was a really good film it wasnt overly complex but it knew the 5 or 6 beats it wanted to hit and it nailed them also and not something i usually notice but i felt like the sound editing was great
i loved this movie it had a great storyline the monster was awesome but dont bring little children its in subtitles and kinda scary for the young ones
fabulous storytelling very engaging  best movie i have seen in a long time  a must see for any moviegoer
better than i expected
absolutely loved this movie if youre a fan of godzilla this movie is a must see

it is amazing to think that a 70 year old movie franchise has delivered us the best feature in its long run since the 1954 original this is the movie that i have waited for a serious dramatic what if that treats every aspect of the situation seriously the acting is top shelf the effects are onpoint save a few dodgy shots of boats in the water but all is forgiven when goji appears and the scriptthe script     it should be a no brainer but having a great script to tie all the monster mayhem together and make us feel for the characters is exactly the ticket    ive seen the movie three times now and each screenings audience has been bigger than the last    long live the king

a mustsee film you cheer for every human character in the film there is so much emotion the effects on godzilla are amazing and he feels like an angry embodiment of war its a remake of the original but pulls in elements from all eras of the franchise the originals plot beats monster island ghidorahs creation plot and legendaries animations
best movie i watched in 2023 will definitely watch again or own it if on itunes for purchase
stunning movie you will be engaged the entire time you will cheer and you will cry

it was nice that toho didnt personify godzilla minus one like legendary has in the monsterverse version this movie was about a giant monster with an animal instinct trying to destroykill people not a bumbling sentient being with a sense of humanity at its core   by definition a monster is frightening and godzilla minus one was just that the monsterverse godzilla is sort of a savior to humanity legendarys version fights ill intended creatures and any sort of damage is collateral whereas minus one is hell bent on destruction  i enjoy both of them but i prefer the mean toho godzilla minus one over the tame legendary godzilla ive seen all of the g movies though the decades this one is imo by far the best

godzilla minus one is awesome it was so good and my opinion the best movie of 2023 hands down

still in awe of what i saw from the visuals to the score to the amazing story line  not just an amazing godzilla movie an amazing movie period
i saw the movie with my friend and all i have to say is are mouths were open the entire movie this movie is not just the best godzilla movie but the best movie ive seen

taking it back to its roots but with an unbelievable focus on the resilient human spirit incredibly well written with massive vfx  suspenseful battles the sound editing emphasizes the emotional impact

a modern day masterpiece i do not often recommend movies but i would recommend this one it was one of those movies where it can be described as perfect or even near perfect the last movie that impacted me so strongly after i left was infinity war by marvel studios godzilla minus one puts hollywood to shame

extraordinary the building of characters in a godzilla movie low key kinda sounds far fetched but the character arks are absolutely flawless and you want every person to triumph the godzilla monster was absolutely stunning visually cant recommend this roller coaster of emotions in a godzilla movie enough

other than the truly outstanding and perhaps unprecedented special effects this is a very bad film made by morons absolutely cringeworthy acting script story line ive never seen more horrible actors in one film do not believe the hype think for yourselves i seriously question the authenticity of the endless five star reviews all saying the same thing i believe the entire japanese cast and production team posted rave reviews for their own film with the help of google translate youve been warned proceed at your own risk prepare to cringe like never before the film is a mess i left thinking what did i just watch i wanted to like it but they all let me down kudos to the monster design and sfx brilliant team
what a great movie  do not let the subtitles stop you from seeing this movie  they do not get in the way at all  this is by far the best godzilla movie ever and isnt like the cheesie ones before this

yes it is true this is the first ever godzilla movie i have ever seen and oh my god what a fing fantastic movie i did not expect to love this movie at this level this was honestly a spur of the moment movie for me id seen everyone talking about this movie the amazing ratings so i booked a ticket which i actually got for free and man oh man this was so worth using my free ticket everything about this movie was amazing from the very beginning of the movie i was just hooked i had no idea what to expect throughout the entire movie it kept me on the edge of my seat the entire time i dont know if this story is another repeat of previous godzilla films or not but all im going to say is that the story is fantastic so well written the line delivery from the cast was amazing those performances top tier the score the cinematography the visuals all of them just top tier especially for a movie about godzilla overall this movie was amazing i loved it easily one of the best 2023 movies and i would easily nominate this movie for the oscar of best international film no question there

just saw it tonight with my neice i grew up on the old heisei godzillas then adored the monsterverse made by legendary and this movie is just a sublime mix of both largely heisei the use of the original godzilla themes was nostalgic but not cringey and the terror i felt for the characters was great a godzilla movie made me elated for its human characters thats incredible
i liked this take on this movie

godzilla minus one is a great addition to the godzilla franchise a contrast to wbs godzilla films this is very reminiscent of the early godzilla films i would say the writing is phenomenal and beautifully written the cg is a little lacking and godzilla is a bit stiff but the story and acting are fantastic i would say it is worth seeing if you are a fan of godzilla or just a good story

i have two godzilla tattoos 4 movie posters 4 original set photos signed by the original cast have over 20 godzilla art pieces so i believe i have a good opinion when it comes to godzilla films this film is the best over the last 70 years it is an absolute must see act 2 does get a little slow for my liking but the pacing allows you to like the characters even more usually i root for godzilla this movie made me flip best human characters in a godzilla film which makes the ending that much more sweet  should be awarded best foreign film
the movie is epic in so many ways godzilla looks amazing the story is riveting the soundtrack is awesome definitely see this on the big screen

the terror the sorrow the destruction the crying easily top 5 godzilla movie and honestly this probably tops my personal list bringing godzilla back to basics hes the king of monsters yes but hes the embodiment of pure chaos takashi yamazaki brings the original kaiju back to basics at godzillas core it is the catalyst of destruction it ruins peoples lives the macabre of everyones fear something unpredictable and uncontrollable i love it as much as americans want to heroize the king of monsters at the end of the day godzilla is a force of destructive nature that unapologetically reeks terror on the land with that depiction of godzilla done correctly like it is here youre not going to have anything less of a top tier godzilla cinematic experience what adds on to greatness of this film is the powerful story yes this is yet another retelling of the origin but the film grounds you with the people you know they have survived a terrible event of biblical proportions you feel for them you feel their trauma it shows the perseverance of man and your chosen family this film even manages to squeeze in some laughs in terms of range and tone everything is perfectly balanced in my opinion the actors are great in showing their trauma love and fear great cast all around the cgi is stunning they went with the modern godzilla look but succeed in showing the battle damage he endures the close up shots are mega detailed the attention to detail for the in sea shots are amazing but what takes the cake is the atomic breathe in recent memory i cant remember godzillas beam being that damn disastrous along with an awesome soundtrack and the euphoria of hearing godzillas theme at the most appropriate times the cinematography is easily the best in any of the live action godzilla movies even better than gvk which is fantastic in its own right if youre a godzilla fan or even just a movie monster fan you have no reason to check this movie out it checks all the boxes and then some in terms of what makes godzilla great

great filmmaking and strong committed cast  its godzilla 1947 japan a period piece with aaa period detail thruout  its also godzillanoir the main character struggles over and over with survivor guilt from wwii  its nothing like the more upbeat westernized legendary godzilla with the monarch overstory  where the monarch godzilla is more dramatic and imaginative godzilla 1947 is more about honoring godzilla as an artistic japanese creation  at the end after godzillas takedown all the sailors salute godzilla      its great filmmaking the script took three years to write  the inevitable godzilla takedown is a collaborative effort of decommissioned japanese naval sailors a voluntary group of citizens working against impossible odds  an even greater positive collaborative group effort can be seen in the great chinese film the wandering earth netflix  the script took three years to write  its basically a nonironic remake of godzilla 1954 reimagined with better plot better human characters and better vfx     its too long 124 mins  cutting 2025 minutes would have helped it do better at the box office  its also a toho film     washington post  top gun maverick and this godzilla show us theres an audience for movies which combine concise and creative action with emotionally resonant human characters  yes as in the best of the legendary monarch godzillas the balance also works here    film stage  its willing to stay in the quiet anguish of several characters for uncomfortable lengths of time so the ultimate release is all the sweeter    empire  a refreshingly humanist and nostalgic reboot of the iconic monster franchise takashi yamazakis godzilla minus one takes the atomic lizard back to his postwar roots while making the most of the directors background in animation and vfx direction through convincing tactile and classic design work
this movie had such an amazing story which had me crying at times godzilla was absolutely terrifying i think this might be the best one ever made

everything in this movie works perfectly takashi yamasakis cinematography is astonishing and memorizing kamiki ryunosukes acting is truly worthy of an oscar as you can feel the intensity and emotion in his character godzilla is one of if not the best antagonist in 2023 as godzilla leaves no mercy for anyone the only issue that i had was the fact that since it was made in japan the movie needed subtitles to translate it into english and the translations distracted me from being able to fully watch everything around the film overall though it is a great film that has some of the best conflict and possibly the best third act ever

i came out of the movie theater thinking wow this movie is the first godzilla movie that has focused on the heart and the plot of the story instead of the action and special effects i wouldnt change a thing about the plot the movie also has a sense of redemption both for the characters and world war 2 japanese culture this movie is jaws with japanese soldiers even though the ending was slightly predictable and the cgi of the godzilla was a little sketchy at times i was still impressed this movie is very sad and intense there were some scenes where my heart was pounding and my fingernails were digging into my legs i think that this is a great movie must see

fellow movie goers beware this redundant addition to the godzilla franchise is one of the worst movies ive ever seen recommended by rt and im afraid there might be some kind of shady action here i cant imagine anyone not insulted by this hot mess where i can see benefits from this movie is teaching aspiring film students what not to do lets start at the beginning unlike its cousin the surreal rodan 1956 yamazaki breaks the first rule of monster moviemaking by showing him in the opening scene in the same scene the hero gets a chance to fire a 40 mm gun at big g but doesnt why after this 10minute scene we get a lot of who cares screenwriting trying desperately to bring human gravity to what is essentially an overthetop thrill ride monster movie really seeing a movie like this makes one appreciate spielbergs human touch in his classic jaws all the scenes are too long ploddingly paced and the screenwriting is cliche boring and wildly predictable the film looks like its been blown up from 16 mm and the special effects still make big g look like a guy in a rubber suit aside from names like kurosawa and ozu maybe japan should stick to building great cars and leave the monster genre to the young at heart

a refreshing take on the kaiju genre    unlike recent hollywood godzilla films which often prioritize spectacle over substance godzilla minus one takes a more grounded approach the film is set in postwar japan a time of great hardship and uncertainty godzillas arrival is not just a disaster but also a symbol of the nations trauma and resilience    this focus on human drama elevates the film above your average monster movie the characters are welldeveloped and relatable and their struggles are genuinely affecting we see the impact of godzillas destruction on their lives both physically and emotionally

what a glorious return of liveaction godzilla to the hands of actual japanese filmmakers this film is about so much more than godzilla using the aftermath of wwii as a powerful backdrop and exploring deeply personal and emotional moments with our small cast of characters its got the action and the beautiful jawdropping destruction youd expect from our kaiju friend but it doesnt get so caught up in the fanfare that it loses touch the cgi while not quite seamless is incredibly impressive given the films tiny budget some of the acting and dialogue are a little over the top for my taste but its definitely a bit of a cultural thing overall this is a great return or introduction to godzilla for anyone who loves a great story beautifully written characters and a little monster mashing

much like shin godzilla before it godzilla minus one seeks a return to the solomonster horror roots of the franchise while shin godzilla served as a critique of a bureaucracy unable to respond adequately to crisis minus one aims for a more personal story of survivors guilt and trauma and pulls it off exceptionally well     godzilla being so large steals the screen whenever its around and its mere presence is enough to cause catastrophic loss of life without it even intending such devastation once again a manifestation of the horror of atomic warfare the creature is once again reimagined and doesnt suffer for having a lesser height than its american counterpart    all in all godzilla minus one elevates itself above being just a giant monster movie and manages to craft a touching and dramatic personal story amidst a country struggling with its identity

ive loved godzilla movies since i was a kid  the recent us adaptations were entertaining but still lacked something that made the original 1954 movie so effective  this movie captures the magic of the original and then some  behind the special effects and musical score is a great story and character development  you begin to feel for the characters as they try to adjust to postwar life and deal with the appearance of a giant monster  this makes godzilla more scary because you see it from the perspective of the people  it feels a bit more like a horror movie than the us monsterverse movies

godzilla minus one is a riveting and captivating film that redefines the boundaries of the classic monster genre this cinematic masterpiece directed by visionary filmmakers seamlessly blends cuttingedge cgi with a compelling narrative delivering an unforgettable experience for both diehard fans and newcomers alike    the movie sets a new standard for storytelling within the monster universe skillfully crafting a storyline that delves deep into the emotional core of its characters while maintaining the aweinspiring spectacle of colossal creatures battling it out on the big screen the character development is exceptional offering a poignant exploration of humanitys resilience in the face of unimaginable devastation    one of the most striking aspects of godzilla minus one is its breathtaking visual effects the meticulous attention to detail in bringing these legendary monsters to life is nothing short of astonishing every roar every thunderous footstep and every destructive clash between titans feels incredibly realistic immersing the audience into the heart of the action    moreover the films musical score deserves immense praise for enhancing the overall atmosphere and intensifying the emotional impact of each scene the soundtrack perfectly complements the onscreen spectacle creating a symphony of epic proportions that resonates long after the credits roll    in addition to its technical brilliance godzilla minus one successfully balances adrenalinepumping action sequences with moments of genuine depth and introspection it explores themes of sacrifice bravery and the indomitable human spirit making it a thoughtprovoking and emotionally resonant cinematic journey    overall godzilla minus one is a tour de force in the realm of monster movies setting a new benchmark for the genre with its breathtaking visuals compelling storytelling and powerful performances this film is an absolute mustwatch that will leave audiences exhilarated and moved in equal measure

godzilla minus one thoroughly defied my expectations every single scene feels weighty and impactful not just the ones that feature the titular monster destroying tokyo     i never once found myself impatiently wishing for the real action to begin because the movie actually gave me reasons to be invested in the characters its an excellently crafted experience the themes permeate all throughout the storytelling the characters are relatable and well written godzilla is terrifying the performances can be heartwrenching and it is just incredibly evident that the director takashi yamazaki had a real vision for this movie anyone that worked on this film absolutely deserves to be proud of their work    its great and im eagerly awaiting whatever takashi yamazaki does next

wife and i saw godzilla minus one the first weekend and totally recommend it it really is the best godzilla film ever made from a human and dramatic standpoint    the film is not really about the monster its about the people struggling to survive in postwar japan there are heartbreaking moments that dont have anything to do with godzilla    the monster isnt in most of the film but when it appears good god the effects are amazing this isnt a guy in a rubber suit kicking toy cars around there are some moments when godzilla is attacking warships that just took my breath away  and this film was made for 15m  it raises the question how did hollywood lose the ability to make compelling films on a budget    it had some nice touches like the us allowing japan to rearm some of their ships to deal with the menace and postwar tension between the us and the soviets comes in to play  its not a monster movie its more like what if godzilla happened in the real world at the tail end of world war ii    theres a heartbreaking moment where a former admiral addresses a room full of emotionally scarred combat vets trying to raise enough volunteers to fight the monster  these people are all emotional wrecks completely exhausted defeated and for many with their families destroyed but somehow have to pull themselves together to meet this new challenge  its a very compelling scene and would work in a variety of genres not just monster films    its just a really good film like scorsese had done a monster film  go see it    my understanding is that there will be a competing godzilla film released next year and theres some kind of contractual thing where they both cant be in theaters at the same time  so end of december 2023 godzilla minus one has to leave theaters    the real tragedy is that this film is popular and theaters could really use the business
the best film ive seen this year by far
it was incredibly wellbalanced the action is captivating the emotional journey of the protagonist is engaging and relatable and the effects although wonky at moments are absolutely stunning

i give it 4  half only because godzilla didnt have as much screen time as i wanted but thats just me loving the monster its a good touching drama story plus the action scenes totally worth it and the ending wow no regrets and it wont be for you either im glad i saw it on the big screen thank you again godzilla creators

this is a good moviebut not great  upfront i am not a huge godzilla fan but this was very well done  it has subtitles and while i typically hate subtitles they actually improve this movie and it would been worse if it had been done in english    unlike the other godzilla movies i have seen in the past they made the characters compelling something their competitors the marvels new hunger games and wish failed to do      i have pity for the failed and flawed male lead definitely not a mary sue  my heart went out to the female lead as well  both of them have compelling character arcs  their goals and life choices are logically consistent with how they were presented by the director  moreover the director presented traditional japanese culture in a thoughtful way without unnecessary negative commentary     this is a godzilla movie so do not expect to see accuracy in science this is meant to be fun not technically accurate  if you demand technical accuracy this is not the movie for you     in sum this is a fun and novel twist on an old tale that did not need to current day the story    well worth your time

i have been watching godzilla and things like ultraman since i was a kid i think i saw my first godzilla film on bob wilkins creature features on channel 2 out of san francisco i know i saw godzilla vs the smog monster hedorah in a drive through theater which probably was around late 1972 as it took a while to get to the us    anyway i can say this is hands down the best godzilla film however a caveat to that is what makes it so good is because it is a reboot this is how you reboot a film you take the essence of the original storyies and repurpose it this wasnt a blatant nostalgiaest like the last 3 crap star wars films this was them using the tropes perfectly the scientist with the weird hair the hardened old soldier the stern military guy with no neck and on and on it was perfect    i like to say the people my age have star wars music in our dna well listening to the music shows i have kaiju in the blood as well the music was almost a character itself plus there is so much i can say about this but wont for space reason i will say this is one of the few godzilla films ive ever seen where the human story is just as good as watching godzilla do his thing  and there was no annoying kid sidekick  thank the maker    go see this film right now

its difficult for me to explain how much raw joy this movie made me feel its been a long time since a godzilla film made me care about the people it followed shin godzilla had the perfect approach where it was less about individuals and more about how a government would handle a kaiju situation while godzilla minus one focuses hard on a small group of people it also makes you want to stay with that group    the movie has a perfect blend of classic godzilla terrifying in its raw power and primal motivations while also showing you a tale of redemption honor grief and love    if youve ignored most godzillas thinking they were campy schlock im looking at you 2014 2019 2021 you wouldnt be wrong but please do not pass on godzilla minus one    this movie does not treat the audience like idiots nor does it have the feeling of smirking at its intelligence truly perfect

i had all but given up on monster movies until i saw godzilla minus one godzilla minus one brought back my passion for monster movies and has proven one thing no one does it better than the japanese when it comes to godzilla their true creation this is an absolute must see and it is an instant classic in my opinion one of the best monster movies ever made and one of the best godzilla movies ever made  this movie truly pays homage to the original godzilla movies  the storyline was very well crafted and tied very nicely together to fit the general story of godzilla  the characters were very well developed all the emotion suspense and thrill you would expect to see in a film like this were there   if you are one of those people that has lost your zest for monster movies and you are looking for the magic that the classic godzilla movies of old had then godzilla minus one will definitely bring you back from the depths of the sea of japan to love godzilla movies all over again

after almost 70 years toho studios show that they still have great compelling stories to tell in their godzilla series godzilla minus one was a fantastic film that recalls the big gs origins from the 1954 film an antiwar parable of a creature mutated by nuclear radiation the story is well filmed terrifically acted it has great cinematography a rousing score and impressive special effects for a film that was made for about 15 million it looks significantly more expensive while the bulk of the film focuses on the story and human characters this aspect is so well done and keeps you engaged so that when godzilla actually shows up it has greater impact what you get is an emotional compelling thrilling story about regret survivors guilt ptsd redemption and what it means to be a family not only is this one of the best godzilla films ever made its also one of the best films of the year godzilla minus one is a stunning achievement

one of the best movies ive ever seen and possibly the best godzilla film out there every aspect of this movie delivers the acting writing camerawork use of lighting sound and lack of sound  all of it comes together to create an incredible film that anyone can enjoy godzilla fans are rewarded with the use of  as well as the subversion of  tropes that are staple to the franchise familiarity with the series isnt needed to appreciate this film but it can certainly enrich it every second of screen time is used to its fullest the human story is compelling and evocative and the balance of tension dread and relief are expertly handled i have never before experienced a film monster or creature that so effectively instilled a sense of fear and visceral threat godzilla appears as every bit the metaphor he was originally intended to be enriching the human narrative while encapsulating the totality and indiscriminate animal nature of atomic warfare the original creative team would have been so proud and so honored by this work an excellent addition to a 70 year old franchise and when that iconic theme finally drops chills whether youve seen all the films or none at all do yourself a favor and see this one

godzilla minus one just embarrassed hollywood    it would be a tragedy if you didnt watch it because you think you need to be a godzilla fan to enjoy it    im happy to say that this was not only a fantastic godzilla movie but also an absurdly good movie just in general one of the best ive ever seen    i never thought i would see a godzilla movie with this good of a story and believe it or not actually really good human characters that you will actually enjoy as much as godzilla    the story was emotional hit on really good themes and even had some great funny parts without being overly jokey like marvel is now    and then you add godzilla holy crap he has never looked this good or been this angry and there is a lot of him too    and japan did this for only 15 million dollars    absolutely puts hollywood to shame    and for my catholic friends did i mention it promotes good values and is completely clean except for maybe a couple minor curses    as a godzilla fan since i was a kid i couldnt be happier i didnt think a godzilla movie this good on so many levels was possible    easily the best movie of 2023 and the best godzilla ever by a lot

what can i say about this masterpiece of kaiju cinema i was left speechless when the credits rolled hell even after this film has everything a monster movie lover needs and then some in addition to the truly horrifying presentation of godzilla and the destruction he wreaks there is a very human story that tugs at the heart and captures all kinds of emotions amazingly hope despair love fear an astounding amount of emotion can be found here and the actors display them excellently the original soundtrack is also an unexpected treat while the movie makes use of the classic ifukube theme much of the movie makes use of original compositions by naoki sato these inspire such vivid feelings of helplessness an overwhelming power hellbent on the destruction of whatever stands in its way and on the other hand tracks like resolution raise you up filling you with hope as the characters are determined to fight and beat this godly force the effects are amazing as well giving us one of the best looking godzilla movies to date while returning to his more classic look as opposed to the charred visage of shingoji this minusgoji is still one of the most terrifying incarnations of the lizard with piercing eyes and tremendously physical performances of strength all together this isnt just a perfect godzilla film its also one of the best films of the entire year another win for goji

this is a spoiler free review   how good was this movie  ask yourself when is the last time you went to a theater and at the end of the movie the audience broke out into applause  the pacing was excellent in a remarkably short time frame they did so much character development  every main character was well rooted and extremely believable  you couldnt help but feel their joys and sorrows throughout the movie  the action sequences were perfectly timed well organized never dragged out for the sake of some cheap gratuitous violence or shock  it all fit together so well i cant think of a single point where the movie dragged  the setup and payoff were so well done and so satisfying  partway in my friend was looking at his phone i was kinda like wft  after the movie i found out it was because of his watch  it monitors his heart rate and it posted an alert basically asking him if he was ok because his heart rate was so high  yea the movie was that kind of edge of your seat exciting  this was clearly patterned after the original 1954 gojira original  and no offense intended to the award winning cinematic masterpiece that the original was but i think this might have been better than even that  go see this
many scenes played homage to the orginals films the modeltoy trains and tanks were perfect thank you toho

cant say ive ever really been a fan of godzilla but my god has that changed this is everything a godzilla movie should be from the writing acting special effects character development the score its all perfect the sound design is so immersive and awesome you feel like youre right there with the main characters i was mesmerized throughout the whole film not only with the incredible action sequences and godzillas awesome heat ray but with the characters we get to spend time with in between both honestly equally riveting i didnt want anyone to die even the random patrons in the background and thats because our main characters are so fleshed out they make you feel and really sit with the fact that japan just finished ww2 and now they have a giant monster terrorizing their country and you just cant imagine what thats like but theyre all willing to fight and sacrifice for their families and a better future for japan it was awesome highly recommend the first time we see the heat ray godzilla has wow one of the coolest things ive ever seen on film

watching this piece of extraordinary japanese filmmaking is the closest ive gotten to the spine tingling delight i received when as a young boy i first saw the original 50s godzilla film on tv but unlike the americanized raymond burrized genesis of the franchise this astounding film draws you in with deep emotions delving into the tragedy that was postwar japan in the immediate aftermath of wwii the characters really matter  for the first time in a kaiju movie  and make you care about how to defeat the nuclearized big bad which in this case is the scariest godzilla ever witnessed onscreen icing on the cake are the music nods to the original especially the excitement of the marchlike musical accompaniment to the creative 1940sera efforts to put a stop to the seemingly unstoppable creature at the end bravo

if you are a godzilla fan 1010 go see this movie  if you are not a godzilla fan 1010 go see this movie seriously  godzilla minus 1 is an a well made film that honors the original 1956 release  similar to the original the movie is about human characters dealing with the insanity of a giant monster attacking and laying waste to their homeland  in minus 1 they are real people you can connect with which shows quality writing considering it takes place in 1940s defeated japan  this is what sets it apart from the recent hollywood godzilla releases where the humans detract from the film every second they are on the screen  minus 1 in contrast has real people experiencing extreme conditions following the war  the pain shikishima deals with connects with the the audience  he is a flawed man dealing with losing everything it is hard not to feel for him  yes this is a monster movie and the humans are adding to the overall film  the monster scenes are shot well the special effects are well done  sound and music score are excellent as well  see this in a good theater with a good sound system    the only caveat is for some people it is in japanese and with subtitles  even so give it a chance after a while you dont even realize you are reading them as you get engrossed in the film  considering the lack of quality films in the theaters lately this one stands out  is it perfect  no i would never say that  but it sure is worth your time and money to go see it

it was so amazing watching godzilla chase the humans on the boat was intense the focus on humanity between the lead and his ghosts of regret the natural relationship with his roommate and adopted child the metaphors of the war ptsd building back only to be brought down the classic score mixed with modern score was near perfection  watching this made me feel like a kid playing with my toys back in the day but now as an adult i can see the horror that comes with the devastation several times i watched in awe at what godzilla can do and the devastation he causes to citizens i didnt like the short arms or the way he walked on land but i understood this is classic toho godzilla and though the cgi on land during sunny daylight was noticeable it cant be faulted with such a low budget it excelled at night and in the water overall this movie was beautifully done

godzilla minus one stands out as an exceptional addition to the godzilla franchise earning a resounding 910 in my assessment shikishimas performance as a kamikaze pilot adds depth to the film showcasing his versatility in portraying a range of emotions the connection between shikishima and noriko adds a human touch to the storyline    the film introduces godzilla in a compelling way with a notable powerup that sets the stage for an intense narrative scenes of destruction including a powerful event in ginza deliver the expected godzilla spectacle tachibanas role transitioning from an odo island survivor to shikishimas ally adds an intriguing layer to the plot    godzilla minus one skillfully plays with audience expectations maintaining viewer engagement in the characters journeys the supporting cast including noba the captain and the kid significantly contributes to the overall narrative    what distinguishes this godzilla installment is its meticulous attention to character development and exploration of postwar themes shikishimas internal struggle and the films exploration of life after war elevate it beyond typical monster movie fare the music scoring featuring both original compositions and nostalgic ifukube moments enhances the emotional resonance of the story    the climax involving a daring plan to confront godzilla is executed with precision the films creativity shines through in the use of unique elements during the battle    in conclusion godzilla minus one is a standout godzilla film that combines monster mayhem with thoughtprovoking character arcs the hints at the end leave room for future narratives without diving into specifics i strongly recommend this movie as the best godzilla experience ive encountered its truly an amazing cinematic journey that both godzilla enthusiasts and general audiences should not miss    spoilers and heres my spoiler review      godzilla minus one is an absolute triumph earning a solid 910 in my book shikishimas portrayal as the conflicted kamikaze pilot adds depth to the film showcasing his range in expressing emotions from fear to triumph the dynamic between him and noriko is compelling adding a human touch to the godzilla narrative    the powerup of godzilla with menacing dorsal spines and the imminent threat of his devastating beam keeps the audience on the edge of their seats the destruction of ginza and the subsequent scenes including the powerful explosion deliver the expected godzilla spectacle tachibanas evolution from a survivor on odo island to shikishimas reluctant ally adds an intriguing layer to the storyline    the film cleverly toys with our expectations especially regarding tachibanas escape pod keeping the audience engaged in the characters fates the supporting cast including noba the captain and the kid contribute significantly to the overall narrative    what sets this godzilla installment apart is the meticulous attention to character development and the exploration of postwar trauma shikishimas internal struggle combined with the poignant themes of choosing to live after the horrors of war elevates the film beyond typical monster movie fare the music scoring featuring both original compositions and nostalgic ifukube moments enhances the emotional resonance of the story    the climax involving a daring plan to sink godzilla and the subsequent showdown is executed with precision the use of freon bubbles and co2 balloons adds a unique twist to the battle showcasing the creativity in the films storytelling    the finale delivers an unexpected emotional punch challenging our perceptions of sacrifice and survival the salute as godzillas body disintegrates is a powerful visual moment reinforcing the themes of the film    in the end godzilla minus one stands out as a standout godzilla film blending monster mayhem with thoughtprovoking character arcs the flash of godzilla sinking starting to regenerate hints at the potential for future narratives this movie not only pays homage to the iconic franchise but also pushes its boundaries making it a mustwatch for both godzilla enthusiasts and those seeking a deeper cinematic experience

this film is a masterpiece this film is a towering achievement in tokasatsu cinema for fans of kaiju films japanese monster movies this film tops the list of mustsee cinema for those who are not monster movie fans this film has such a heartfelt moving plot that you will not be bored when godzilla isnt on screen this film has the best characters ive seen in a monster movie since the original godzilla film gojira of 1954    like other great films this movie bends genres a little bit this film is a monster movie but its also a family drama a tale of surviving war this movie bends several genres of film into one emotional story that makes the human characters incredibly engaging and godzilla seem down right evil in many godzilla films we find ourselves rooting for godzilla not this time in this film there comes a moment where it becomes clear that godzilla has to be stopped there is a point where godzillas malevolence is so clearly a threat to our characters that you actively root for his defeat    please go see this film in japanese with english subtitles i saw this film yesterday and i plan to see it again before the week is through 1010 greatest monster movie ever made

best godzilla movie in decades the visuals were done well on a mere 15 million budget from toho instead of portraying earths savior like in the american versions godzilla goes back to his roots as a terrifying menace for the citizens of japan what really separates this movie from all other kaiju films is the human storyline instead of dealing with science fictional topics such as aliens or creating a basic story with forgettable characters godzilla minus one gives us characters with solid backgrounds and throughout the movie you build an emotional connection with almost every one of them they also tackle very difficult subjects to talk openly about in societysuch as ptsd survivors guilt and depression overall godzilla minus one is a mixture of the original 1954 film with a tone and character arc similar to jaws while also mixing in tidbits of jurassic park all bias towards the godzilla films we grew up watching put to the side this could very well be the greatest kaiju movie of all time

no spoilers    my favorite godzilla film by far to be fair i havent yet seen shin godzilla but im extra motivated to now     minus one hits on so many levels and really brings back the magic of the film medium     the alternate history post wwii setting in japan is very much real and alive in the story and you are immediately pulled into the struggles of the recently defeated empire with their own unique cultural and material hardships as experienced through the fantastic cast of compelling characters there are multiple moments where i had realizations that im not used to seeing these stories on film the post wwii japan stories and struggles     this movie is heartfelt and thematically rich     and the monstertruly a monster and a force of nature is a good way to describe him they did reshoot some of the scenes of the first film but also added some new tricks and fresh ideas with innovative moments i especially like that some of the movement of godzilla seemed to be an homage to the original suit movement and it totally worked at other times he does move in a much more menacing and agile way hes fierce     the score worked amazingly and whereas im usually like a corpse watching moviesi actually had some reactions to scenes with this one because it was super easy to react in concern or celebration for the characters     this thing is epic and gripping and i havent ruled out a second viewing this coming weekend

a sequel to shin godzilla this was not the acting was not great most of the time with but a few actors doing a decent job the characters could have been pretty good but their arcs never paid off in a way i felt satisfied by godzilla was not around in much and i know thats often the case in these movies however the really good entries do a great job of keeping godzilla present in your mind and as a source of tension while he isnt on screen spoilers godzilla was too fast and nimble godzilla was surprisingly small for some reason maybe to make it more believable that hed be so fast and nimble the movie was too long with too many scenes with characters i didnt find very compelling the child probably could have been erased from the script to cut some fat off the runtime and make the character motivations a bit stronger spoiler end  i heard in a director interview that the goal was to make the scariest godzilla yet but i was underwhelmed by the design choices for the creature and if they were trying to make the movie itself the scariest yet i wish more inspiration had been taken from shin godzillas visual style   the best part of the movie was definitely the music i just wish it hadnt been wasted on this film as it did most of the heavy lifting i understand its a very japanese film made for japan so i hope japanese audiences enjoyed it and i hope the true fans of the godzilla franchise got something they wanted out of this one but i was disappointed the whole way through

it is a fantastic movie one the best story driven godzilla movies ever made in my humble opinion amazing effects even for a godzilla movie it is a period piece that takes place in post ww2 japan this is where some disconnect happens with american audiences i am of japanese decent and my parents experienced post ww2 japan there were many heart felt scenes that demonstrated suffering with japanese cultural sensibilities that struck a chord with me that left others around me in the audience audibly snickering if you lack empathy for those suffering with ptsd and survivors guilt in other cultures that are not your own then this movie is not for you because it is the primary motivation of the main character throughout this movie

yamasakis reimagining of godzilla as allegory for personal and collective wartime trauma is a worthy companion to hondas original classic     theres enough spectacle for casual kaiju fans compelling characters for those who arent and plenty of thematic weight for those who want it yamazaki threads a tight needle and succeeds in making one of the franchise as well as of the genre all together

if you require your special effects and acting perfect to western standards this movie isnt for you  it has a ridiculously lumbering and thick godzilla and bad overacting  that being said if you loved the original japanese godzilla movies as corny as they were youll love this   it shares a lot in common with the original godzilla movie   despite its foreign sensibilities that some western audiences my find lacking their are some surprisingly deep and resonate themes at playlike the shame and trauma of a soldier for instance     its a godzilla movie so dont expect every aspect to be logicallike how long it would have taken to attach all those tugboat lines to the warships during the climax  lol   my only complaint  was they broadcast the twist in the ending a bit too much and i would have preferred the less happy version of the ending   but overall loved it

i first became a fan of godzilla in 2014 when director gareth edwards directed the aptly titled godzilla i remember the crowd cheering when the mutos head was taken off by godzillas heat ray so imagine my excitement when i hear director gareth edwards had seen this movie and revealed his thought and it was of envy he wished he had made a movie as good as this one let me tell you folks hes not wrong because this may be the best since the original which is my personal favorite   the 1954 gojira became my favorite godzilla as soon as i saw it and has never been contested until now godzilla minus one is most definitely the best since the original but is the only one that stands to rival it in quality heart narrative acting and themes godzilla himself is at his most brutal and violent in this movie targeting individuals with intent the devastating effects of godzillas rampages are both an awe and terror to behold also lets not forget the modest budget that was less than 15 million yet the film achieves fantastic visuals and set design  i was immersed in this heartfelt somber yet hopeful story ive seen this film twice over now and i recommend everyone to see this film in the cinema as many times as you can not only because its amazing but we need to support amazing films such as this in a time where 300 million plus movies are delivering us subpar quality     in short godzilla minus one is a spectacular blockbuster and my favorite movie of the year

perhaps the best in the entire franchise since the 1954 original  i was both surprised and deeply moved by the intricate and powerful human storyline usually the people in godzilla movies are little more than pointandscream fodder or play out soap opera tropes in what is basically padding between scenes of rampage and destruction  in godzilla minus one the characters are faced with constant struggle but manage to endure and there was nary a dry face by the time the credits rolled another great aspect of this movie is the groundview perspective of godzillas attack against the cities  theyre wellrendered to be absolutely terrifying  i went into this movie fearing the franchise had run its course and there was no way to make it fresh and vibrant after 70 yearsbut toho studios has delivered an incredible masterpiece and one that i plan to see over and over

godzilla minus one is incredible cant believe it only cost 15m to make godzilla is like this rampaging angry injured animal that does not have peace  his war is never over      for a split second i thought they were breaking the rules of godzilla and he was eating people  but then he shows that he has no care whatsoever to eat someone and only wants to kill people and destroy stuff  and if there was any doubt he shows it again     beautiful horrible  destruction he is so bloodthirsty that he doesnt think and is hyper focused at times     there is no marvel move bullcrap no annoying comedy relief sidekick no string of quippy one liners during action sequences no one sided politically motivated preaching     just the undeniable truth that war is a totally horrible thing and all lives matter no one is disposable

one of the best  if not the best movie of 2023  godzilla minus one this movie contains many layers  historical culturally romantically and last but not least the best monster and godzilla movie of all time with a budget of only 15 million godzilla minus one looks more like the best 220 million marvel movie this is better than most marvel movies the pacing of the movie is fantastic lots of action sequences that tie perfectly into the story line like pairing your best chocolate and red wine the surround sound makes you feel like you are in the midst of the action my daughter  age 6  was frightened but excited by the sheer magnitude of godzillas force she wants to see it again this is one bad monster move over john wick  there is a new sheriff in town see it on imax

first off im not a godzilla fan and not a fan of subtitles and i dont write reviews i feel this one needs some exposer since its so good and im worried people will miss out  this years movie releases have been so bad i hadnt even gone to the theater in 2023 i heard a ton of buzz about this movie and decided to give it a chance i have watched some classic subtitled japanese movies like 7 samurai and it was worth the watch but im generally not a fan of subtitles    back to the point godzilla minus one was a great flick i decided to see it in the theater because ive never seen a godzilla movie on the big screen and i thought the subtitles would be easier to read i was right the theater sounds and the big screen made it heart pumping i dont remember the last time id felt an actual adrenaline rush watching a film the subtitles were much easier to keep up with also and didnt feel like a slog keeping up with the dialog there was young girl with her dad sitting near me and she did have trouble keeping up with the subtitles so keep that in mind if youre taking your kids and theyre maybe not the fastest readers    i think i might have liked the history aspect a little better than the monster but again im not a godzilla fan theres a very good lovehistory story thats integral to the plot i use the word history a little loosely since its modified a bit but generally its correct and would be helpful to know the basics prior to watching the movie the monster is just a force of nature in early postwar japan and the effects were great ive heard theyre practical effects but i dont know if thats true i couldnt really tell so if they are practical effects they did a great job and generally looked better than what hollywood has been pushing out for the last few years plus you actually get to see the monster in good light doing things not cut shots and in the dark to try and make him scary but save money on the effects    id really recommend seeing this its so different than the hollywood godzilla movies its worth it just to see how its interpreted by the nation that created him

it was fine  on the plus side the visual effects were pretty good most of the time esp considering the small budget and godzilla was scary and had personality  the immediate postwar setting of this film lends the metaphor of godzilla more weight and it has an overall uplifting message while being critical of government       unfortunately the human element of the story was excessively melodramatic the movie hides information from you to generate fake tension that none of the characters themselves feel because they know something you dont and plot contrivances abound with characters inexplicably finding each other in chaotic crowded locations that make no sense    it was a completely fine movie but im not quite sure what all the fuss is about
was blown away the ginza scene was one of the best ive seen in any movie the score and story were fantastic definitely worth the price of admission

godzilla minus one 2023 is a great kaiju film and a worthy addition to the godzilla franchise it is a respectful and nostalgic tribute to the original godzilla film and also a fresh and modern take on the genre it has a strong and emotional story a likable and relatable cast a majestic and menacing godzilla and a stunning and realistic visual effects it is a film that appeals to both fans and newcomers of godzilla and it is a film that celebrates the 70th anniversary of the franchise it is a film that deserves to be seen on the big screen and it is a film that will make you feel a range of emotions from fear and awe to sadness and joy it is a film that will make you think and feel and it is a film that will make you appreciate the king of monsters

i guess you could call me a gfan and if you too are a gfan then you too must watch this movie    of the 38 godzilla films out there japanese  us ive seen 36 but i own them all and have for a while now most gfans know shin godzilla 2016 was a high point for the toho godzilla films we really wanted to see a sequel come off of that reboot for the franchise well toho had other ideas and decided to make minus one instead     this film plus godzilla x kong the new empire sort of makes up the 70th anniversary of the godzilla franchise along with the apple tv monsterverse series    this movie had a significantly smaller budget than youre used to not only for a godzilla movie but for movies in general 15 million is difficult to fathom in modern times and for the most part the movie looks very competent shin godzilla 2016 had set the standard for japanese godzilla film effects but minus one bests it    this film also has a much smaller scope than youre used to for a godzilla film but for me was a good point arguably when of the best human stories ever for a gentry this also go well with a miniscule budget and this time you actually care for the protagonists    at 2 hours 10 minutes this exceeds the typical kaiju sweet spot of 90 minutes to 1 hour 45 minutes there were some quietdialog scenes that dragged a little for me and for the first 2 thirds most events were fairly predictable what i was not expecting were developments that came in the third act which i will not spoil    the score utilizing the iconic og godzilla theme is off the chain most of the movie is not booming loud but scenes featuring the original theme blew me away sonically and then some    as a nice chaser if you are also a gfan of the legendary pictures monsterverse movie i would also recommend the apple tv monarch legacy of monsters series    my quickie review on this movie and more can be found on our movie review podcast prognosis negative wherever you listen to podcasts
an absolutely wonderful blend of emotion cgi and weight this film brought absolutely recommend for anyone not just long time godzilla fans

godzilla minus one really surprised me  ive never been a huge fan of godzilla movies or that genre  however i may rewatch some of the older godzilla movies thanks to minus one  this movie was excellent it was a highly enjoyable experience  i like that the movie explored a couple of interesting themes besides mayhem and destruction  which was also fun  the godzilla monster also looked incredibly epic
absolute masterpiece    this is what godzilla is in the minds of so many fans

i went expecting a good old campy monster stomp and in the old tradition and instead i got an intensely emotional humanfocused story about the japanese experience of defeat after wwii survivors guilt a chance for redemption and the choice to live  the story was set in the ruins of japan after wwii when their country had been largely destroyed but their society had not and it used the experiences of a failed kamakaze pilot as a proxy for the entire nations struggle to redefine duty and purpose in the new era  the existential threat of godzilla was a chance to prove that japans people could stand on their own even against a creature that clearly represented echoes of the countrys very real nuclear trauma  one of the most satisfying parts of the film was the very clear character arc that the main protagonist goes through which included sensitively portrayed moments of ptsd and the importance of relationships in recovery and life purpose  i cannot praise the writing casting and acting highly enough this was without a doubt the best film i have seen in a very long time  both my buddy and i got up from our seats tearyeyed    there are five things that potential viewers should keep in mind   1 this a japanese film about japanese people having an experience in a distinctly japanese historical and cultural context  its not diverse it generally doesnt have an agenda and it does not apologize for the story it is telling  if you need your stories steeped in caveats and humble acknowledgements of tribal land the patriarchy imperialism or whatever else occupies people these days this is not your cup of tea  its a serious story about realistic people not a university kumbaya session  2 the version of the film i saw and to my knowledge the only one was in japanese with english subtitles  this doesnt bother me at all i would rather have the real acting and voices with subtitles any day of the week  some people dont feel the same though so if you really cant handle subtitles then this may not be for you  although i really suggest you put in the effort so you can watch the seven samurai and the hidden fortress  3 the budget for this film was not large and if youre expecting special effects on par with a 250 million usd disney blowout youre going to be disappointed  it was obvious that nearly every wide shot especially the ships was entirely cgi  if youre a stickler for the most believable visuals and any doubt of realism ruins your experience that might be a deal killer  that said because the special effects existed in service to the plot and not as the centerpiece of the film they were absolutely good enough  hollywood take note if your writing and acting is good you dont need to spend the gdp of a small country on asset creation and rendering  4 in certain parts of the film they made liberal use of lowfrequency sound to amp up the drama and anxiety of a scene  legit strategy but it seemed a little overused sometimes where i felt silence would have been better  on the other hand it made the silent parts of the film more impactful by contrast so maybe they made the right choice  5 this story is far better if you have some understanding of japans experience in the prior century leading up to wwii so you understand the context  if youre interested in that i recommend you take a look at dan carlins supernova in the east episodes part of the hardcore history podcast  if youre willing to put 30 hours into the learning process you will be rewarded with a great appreciation for what japanese people went through and the forces shaping japanese thought in that period

this is by far and away the best version of the godzilla franchise that i have seen in a very long time in fact even better than the 1950s classic original the key is the wonderful human element added the plot is just as much about one mans redemption as it is about godzilla on a rampage another original aspect is the timeline this version of godzilla is post world war 2 in a devastated japan what an original plotline a kamikaze pilot loses his nerve and who could blame him and guides his plane to a repair facility on an island claiming mechanical failure with the plane then godzilla appears on the island and starts squashing the solders like bugs this haunts the pilot and causes his own personal war       now lets talk about the monster i love this version of godzilla this is not a version that wants to protect humans this godzilla wants to squash humans and cause general destruction and chaos an evil fiend indeed like a mindless zombie who just wants to feed godzilla just wants to destroy fantastic effects as well very realistic in the destruction scenes       how godzilla was eventually rid of is one of the more original ideas in this type of genre  the only reason i did not give it a full 5 stars is mainly i thought the pilot played by ryunosuke kamiki had a serious case of william shatner overacting     otherwise the best godzilla movie i have ever seen could save the franchise

saw this as a group of 3 men aged 16 45 55 full price tickets at an ok theater with food  drinks all regular adult prices godzilla minus one is easily one of the most fun popcorn movies in recent years it is teriffic fun to see godzilla stomp his way across the big screen in big earthshaking dolby surround but this movie is actually a good movie in its own right i cared about the characters and rooted for them the writing acting and special effects were three or five cuts above the cgi content flushing out of the mouse house tons of destructable models and old school rubber suit stuff fun to watch and technically well done godzilla was a monster of a main character in his own movie not an afterthought we got to see him in seriously terriffying full size in good light with full body shots and closeups just awesome the movie was just over 2 hrs long in japanese with english subtitles we were hooked in the first few minutes time flew by and the subtitles were fine to watch bottom line godzilla minus one is a popcorn movie worth every penny no hidden agenda bs no politics and every full price ticket supports all the great people at toho who made this masterpiece on a shoestring budget with just sweat equity and a love for godzilla movies loved every minute will pay full price to see this again with my grown kids later this month in an mx sound theater if possible go to the theater with a friend and have a great time encourage people to make great movies like this again

absolute cinema thought it was going to be just another cheesy monster movie and while yes godzilla is definitely the reason i saw it the human characters gave the story so much weight theres meaningful character growth in multiple characters that are dealing with themes of ptsd survivors guilt acceptance forgiveness loss hope despair this movie will make you feel feelings its also a legit disaster movie and is not afraid to pull any punches people die horribly and those that dont have to deal with that fact there are many parallels with the original gojira but visually updated for 2023 without looking like a video game not a depressing movie at all but at the same time if you go into it expecting the cheesy camp from some earlier godzilla titles you are in for a rude awakening highly recommended go see it as soon as you can

godzilla minus one is one of the years finest blockbuster films and quite possibly the best godzilla film i have ever seen this is a movie that understands how to create an emotional attachment to characters and thus raises the stakes when the action is going down speaking of the action it is some of the most spectacular stuff you can see in a theater in 2023 this movie is pure entertainment and has plenty of heart and a good story to me it feels like it captures the soul of the original film and flourishes it with modernday special effects and it reminded me a lot of the 2005 king kong film in that way overall this is a thrill ride that has plenty of moments to wow the audience while also remembering to tell a genuinely engaging human story

this is the best godzilla movie ive ever seen and its because of the attention to detail in building the characters through important emotional moments their journeys are everything the film is also a great vision of postwar japan that movie audiences rarely get to see american audiences might have objected to seeing the devastation that the japanese people had endured as a result of american attacks on their homeland but in this new century were in now everyone loves japan and were ready to see their story godzilla itself is a kind of avatar of nature enacting vengeance for violence against the natural world in this genre but but this film also uses the monster to help the audience to empathize with japanese victims of war all the moments are wellearned the monster is truly furious and terrifying effects and cinematography are great and theres also an adorable baby i highly recommend this movie

70 years have been building to this minus one stands as not only the best godzilla film but likely the best in the genre all elements in this film come together in perfect harmony from the animation so good at times youd swear godzilla was real to the music to the outstanding cast the writing is what really makes this movie godzilla action is always fun thats why this franchise has survived for 70 years but all previous films have suffered from characters who are boring and in some cases downright hateful minus one doesnt have that problem the characters are very well written and the story with them is fantastic they grow and face their challenges that mirror the larger conflict of godzillas rampage the story tackles grief ptsd survivors guilt and forgiveness in a moving tale that can bring audiences to tears  do not miss what i can honestly say is the best movie of the year see godzilla on the biggest screen you can and enjoy the ride

generally you can separate the godzilla movies into several categories the eras in which they were produced the americanjapanese films etc  i tend to divide them up into categories in which godzilla is the hero often the films where he battles other kaiju and the ones in which godzilla is a threatening presence in the latter category the original 1954 film will always be at the top  shin godzilla 2016 was an interesting entry and brought a sense of horror with the political commentary but my two favorites after the original are still godzilla returns 1984 and godzilla minus one 2023  minus ones human interest story was full of heart and truly moving with themes of shame guilt forgiveness redemption and ultimately life and this incarnation of godzilla was terrifying  definitely in my top five godzilla films

excellent movie  this is probably the most well written godzilla film to have come out in a long time  its plot base and development of the characters are well written and  established  depressing and sad at times also  this is a human driven story with godzilla as the attraction  you care about what happens to the character and the people   godzilla is not a hero in this film  he is an angry pissed off force of nature  when godzilla shows up he doesnt mess around  for a low budget movie cost is a reported 15 million the visual and special effects are top notch  the movie is by no means perfect but this comes pretty close   disney should be embarrassed with their 200300 million plus flop films that was released recently   this is movie is an overall great movie in general  even if you are not a godzilla or kaiju fan  this will appeal to the wider general audiences
