i saw it early saturday morning but wanted to sit on my thoughts and see how i felt after some time hot dang this movie is amazing of the godzilla films that i have seen this is definitely top tier in my opinion to start off the story is truly captivating heartfelt and told so well it had a perfectly paced build with a satisfying climax and conclusion another positive is that even though it is a foreign film and it had subtitles it caused me to have to pay even closer attention to it which made me appreciate the film that much more at no point was i bored or wanting it to end but on the contrary it kept me invested and wanting more  with only a budget of 15 million this film used it effectively did it have its flaws yes at moments however they made it work and put out an amazing film i am going to rate this film a 95 out of 10

i had been waiting to this for one full year and was not disappointed this godzilla film fully explored the human angle and employed very skilled actors to take the audience in there are moments that will shock you and will make you cry the sheer devastating affect upon the people is overwhelming the director is more than just a director wearing the hats of director special effects creator and writer this guy knew exactly how to make this film and this film most certainly rival the lassie of all classics the original gidzilla king of the monsters this is not a monster movie it is a movie where people have been brought down to their knees and then pushed into the ground and how they respond to those circumstances dramatic terrifying exhilarating and oddly realistic you should see this film

i saw this movie last night in imax and it is now my absolute favorite godzilla movie the story is very well done and i actually cared about the characters  i normally root for godzilla but in this time i was torn  it was an emotional rollercoaster  the graphics are incredible for a 15 million budget this movie is more than graphics  i feel that our criticism of graphics in movies has led hollywood to think that is all we want for entertainment  this movie is so much more than graphics  it has a storyline we can invest in characters we care about lots of action for entertainment a very good music score and the best iteration of godzilla to date  for me it checked off all the boxes  one of it not the best movie i have seen in years

a beautifully shot tragedy grounded in historical fiction at times it feels like youre watching dunkirk or oppenheimer often godzilla movies leave you feeling impatient to get past the humancentric side of the story that was not the case with minus one its heartfelt characters elevated this film from spectacle to existential it has been a long time since someone was able to fully and deftly capture the allegory for the horrors of war that is godzilla

ever since the short 30 second teaser came out in july ive been hooked on this movie and couldnt wait for it to come out now after already seeing it twice all i can say is that this movie is a masterpiece godzilla in this movie was genuinely terrifying and really brought back the vibes of the 1954 original the human characters were perfectly written and takashi yamazaki really makes you care about them and whenever godzilla is on screen you fear for the humans because you dont know if and when godzilla could kill them yamazakis godzilla minus one is easily in contention for movie of the year and is an instant classic

this is a powerful and deeply moving war drama that happens to have godzilla in it the characterization and storytelling are handled masterfully by director takashi yamazaki and his complete vision comes across beautifully the concept feels wholly unique within the existing godzilla franchise as well as within the modern cinematic landscape this movie showcases some of the franchises most endearing characters incredible visual effects and potent commentary on the human condition all of this on a budget of 15000000 unbelievable

i could see the obvious progress of quality from shingodzilla and other legendarys godzilla series its no doubt thanks to all new creators mindset to try to outperform the previous works based on and standing at the established brand godzilla all the successors can benchmark the prior ones and analyze their successful points and failures yamazaki learned a lot from annos work and made some improvements and corrections particularly on the point that it couldnt catch on overseas one of them is the music he succeeded in taking on naoki sato who is the graduate of tokyo university of the music paying respect to the alumni and predecessor ifukube and understanding his music deeply in this film vision and music are fantastically synchronized and of course the main character is godzilla but yamazaki has done well in letting him act simply as a fearful object therefore we can empathize fully with characters competing with godzilla yamazaki who has suffered a streak of bummers in making films looks to be recovering his confidence and is expected to deliver another sequel of godzilla film in which we can see a real duel with monsters like ghidra or mothra

a breath of fresh air amidst all the cookie cutter comic hero politically motivated and regurgitated remakes of stories once loved there is the obvious elephant in the room  in concerns to how the war came to an end but was done in a way to not cheaply push ideals onto new and younger godzilla fans by simply displaying the disconnect of the value of life from world leaders to the everyday lower class person struggling to get by having spent some time in japan personally and was able to admire how the japanese people hold values such as honor and respect above all it was great seeing how someone may have survivors guilt when failing to carry out a kamikaze attack and how the peoples perspective could change and evolve to value their lives and neighbors lives above the honor of duty this perspective ultimately changing in the end with them willing to sacrifice themself when forced to come together to face a devastating threat such as godzilla the movie was perfectly shot and edited to pay homage to the original films and just knocked it out of the park in every aspect from the model  and even the movement of the monster as he destroyed the city chefs kiss the effects and animation was fantastic blurring the lines between practical and computer generated imagery i saw the film in the new and expensive theaters in 4dx where the seats violently jerked and rocked while air and water misted over us with flashing lights on the flanks to simulate explosions and gunfire so lets just say i got ultimate godzilla experience if youre looking to take the kids to see a movie of which you can actually enjoy with them look no further this movie is must see in my book and if im being honest would trade more of hollywood for what japan has to offer go see it

feels like sunday afternoon godzilla when i was a kid in the 80s the characters are unforgettable and when godzilla appears hes shockingly destructive the best godzilla film in years  go see it with the biggest group of people you can  a must see

godzilla minus one blew all my expectations away  what an incredible film it freaking rules it isnt just an amazing godzilla film but one of the best films of the year this truly puts hollywoods versions of godzilla to shame im by no means a godzilla expert but this was easily the best godzilla movie ive ever seen i havent seen an audience this excited and visibly satisfied by a movie in quite some time this film showcases how to make the perfect godzilla picture with a compelling human ensemble and breathtaking action thats savoured from start to finish  plus it truly takes godzilla back to being a truly horrifying monster and has the coolest use of the atomic breath ive ever seen    the action is incredible and brutal and the vfx work is insanely good i also really loved the cinematography and the killer sound design plus the score is excellent and uses akira ifukubes iconic godzilla theme to great effect    but the reason this film stands out is because of its combination of great storytelling mixed with great technical achievements theres reason to care about the characters and a deeply emotional side to this film that makes the monster even more haunting this is a monster film where the human conflict is just as compelling if not more so than the tremendous action sequences i loved the exploration of the traumas of war and cultural destruction in japan following wwii and the ways the characters connected to these themes made for such a strong emotional core this film has the perfect blend of massive monster mayhem and compelling human drama that really worked its so good that you could remove godzilla from the film and still have a great film this is a moving thoughtful japanese character drama set in postwar japan that also happens to have a giant horrific monster in it people are gonna talk about godzilla minus ones amazing production and filmmaking but what surprised me the most was the script every character has an arc and serves a purpose and there are no wasted beats there are so many great dilemmas and dramatic questions also a perfect example of using the monster as a greater metaphor the result is a thrilling epic that feels grounded and meaningful and so so good     godzilla minus one is a nighmasterpiece not only is godzilla terrifying again but the film itself is a powerful drama with some daunting imagery plenty of emotional moments sound design to rock the theatre and a moving character study on postwar guilt and ptsd its a genuinely exciting riveting emotional disaster flick delivering drama you care about and thunderous action spectacle see minus one on the loudest biggest screen you can possibly find and enjoy the ride  its incredible    i gotta add its like act one is jurassic park act two is jaws and act three is dunkirk just such an awesome movie
if your a monster universe lover its 6 stars if you like godzilla its a five star  if you like a good movie its min 4  star   5 out of 5 roars

as a longtime fan of godzilla movies from the earlier films to the modern era i have been part of a fanbase that has endured both gems and dumpster fires but i can honestly say this is the best of the modern series started from the 2010s  the ip has the hollywoodproduced godzilla film of 2014 to thank for the renewed interest that convinced both japanese and american studios to release a series of new movies with now three of them playing with the reboot concept as far as japanese produced live action theatrical movies this is the second one after shin godzilla in 2016     while shin godzilla was an interesting and engaging film set in presentday japan using the 2011 tsunami and nuclear disaster as the backdrop one could definitely feel the evangelioninspired direction from hideki anno it even included the same music from the evangelion composer shiro sagisu it had an almost exhausting plot that is dialogheavy that meshes the human suffering trials and failures along with the politics of managing a situation if such an event were to happen in reality although flawed it is a decent godzilla film with plenty of overthetop monster action coupled with a solution that might be possible to pull off in the real world    godzilla minus zero uses wwii and the start of postwar japan as the setting just as the japanese faced defeat at the hands of the us we follow the story of a kamikaze pilot who must deal with his situation when he chooses to neglect his duty not willing to die for something he sees as pointless as he chose not to die he feels that his war is not over and this message is what drives his story     his path crosses the famous monster at a relatively early stage of its development and is described as a dinosaurlike monster which was interesting to see the events that follow our small group of characters is a series of highly relatable human struggles as the japanese citizens try to recover from the war but are faced with another threat in godzilla the familiar origin story from previous films of islandbased nuclear testing causing mutations in godzilla is the main cause for its massive size and abilities including the heatatomic breath and regenerative properties    the movie is smart enough to give a very plausible method of defeating the monster even though we as an audience know it will work in the end the way it is presented seems possible with the wwii technology of the time there is some doubt on if it will actually work against the monste even up until the end of the film we even get cameos of some famous japanese warships so fans of naval history kancolle or azur lane might get a kick out of that like i did    the cgi effects were mostly believable since were past the point of a man in a rubber suit the play the part of godzilla the design and some of the effects of this version of godzilla reminded me of the 2014 movie along with some shin godzilla elements this is probably the best godzilla has looked in any of the modern movies godzilla takes up just enough screen time so that youre not bored out of your mind seeing the monster destroy countless buildings which doesnt actually happen as much as youd think also we get to see the creature clearly enough so its not completely shrouded in mystery  regarding godzillas attacks the famous atomic breath is seen as highly devastating equal to that of an atomic bomb explosion that is actually used sparingly and the effects that are presented when godzilla uses it were impressive     overall as someone who has seen most of the modern liveaction godzilla movies this one was the most enjoyable with a believable plot and highly relatable characters it takes the human element of people struggling to survive in a postwar environment coupled with the unknown threat of a seemingly invincible monster it is brilliantly directed with actors that truly convey the weight of their situation that never crosses the line of something superhuman to overcome the threat in godzilla using subtle visual effects excellent cinematography a smart script along with some of the classic soundtrack of the old godzilla movies it does feel like this movie could have been made in the same period as those old movies theres no attempt to go overboard and give the audience sensory overload to convince them what they are watching is a good film like with modern superhero movies    as a godzilla movie it is probably the best and out of all the movies this year in 2023 this is one of the best if not the best

this is an absolutely incredible movie i love every aspect of what was done with this godzillas new look and horrifying temperament made for one terrifying big screen experience the music was very well done  but there were also plenty of moments that had very heavy atmosphere where there was no background music or ambient sound to distract you from what was on screen in the aftermath of all of godzillas destruction the lingering silence was very eerie the way they did his voice and overall temperament in this case aggression towards mankind was incredible the way godzilla developed throughout the movie as a result of atomic radiation was amazing to see  some of the aerial scenes from an airplane perspective had me just about jumping out of my seat as godzilla was snapping his jaws at the pilot i watched this twice in the d box at megaplex and both times felt like this was almost like a ride and a movie because the seats would move in conjunction with the waves affecting the boats on screen because this is a foreign film i do not know any of the actors but the entire cabsolutely nailed it and did a fantastic job in some godzilla movies the human element leaves much to be desired that is certainly not the case in this masterpiece of a movie this is probably the best godzilla movie ive ever seen and i have seen them all  if youre looking for a fun thrilling movie i highly recommend you go see this while its in the movie theater to enjoy it and all of its majesty on the big screen

godzilla minus one is one of the best godzilla movies ever made i should know ive been watching godzilla movies since i was five years old its essentially a reimagined version of the first godzilla film released in 1954     this is a japanese movie with english subtitles that kicks things off at the end of world war ii in wartorn tokyo the plot is definitely man vs monster this is not a multimonster extravaganza and godzilla is not a good guy this time around facing impossible odds our protagonists japanese navy veterans and civilians employ science and ingenuity to take on a seemingly invincible radioactive creature from the deep     ill admit the film drags at times between battles and attacks but a good plot means you cant have nonstop action or the audience would be exhausted what will really blow your mind is that this film was made on a shoestring budget of only 15 million i guess when you have a good story you dont need 200 million in cgi and special effects directors and producers all over hollywood need to take a good look in the mirror and question how much money it actually takes to deliver a movie with a good story    godzilla minus one should definitely be in the running for best foreign film at the oscars i loved it and i think you will too i give this film 3 12 stars out of 5

this film is an emotionally impactful human drama set against the backdrop of a devastated postww2 japan and the emergence of an existential threat in the form of godzilla     godzilla minus one is focused on a young soldier wracked with guilt over his actions during the war his struggle to accept life and allow himself to love again is very moving  godzilla is the threat to those he cares about but also the opportunity to resolve his crisis assuage his feelings of guilt and redeem himself    the special effects are impressive despite an almost unbelievably small budget there is a reality to the devastation that was never achieved post the original film add to it that one cares about the characters    the score is very affecting and unusual for a godzilla film there were wonderful callbacks to ifukubes score to the original earlier films too    artfully directed well written earnestedly acted by a convincing ensemble castthis is surprisingly one of the best movies of the year

together with shin godzilla toho brings back the original premise of 1954 godzilla to a global audience a human centric story where the citizens work together to have a fighting chance against godzilla a walking unstoppable monster that brings the nation to brick of annihilation even if the government fails them     whats shocking is the amount of risk toho taking with the setting a post world war 2 japan with the protagonist being a kami kaze pilot if you arent familiar these are the suicide jets that flies straight to high value targets without any means of escape    i am pleased to say the movie does not glorify the ww2 japan its a movie about survival wanting to live wanting to move beyond the haunting past that has drown the nation    the movie says a lot about how japanese felt during postwar japan the anger nihilism sorrow makes it difficult for some to even accept the joy of life some eventually did some are still living in the past    godzilla being the villain of the movie brings in yet another complete destruction that valuable rebuilt progress sounds familiar the constant earthquakes in japan the lost decades of japan after the economic crisis for a nation that tries so hard it seems the odds are always stacked against them the glimmer of hope just never stays    the plot spends a lot of time and effort building up its characters which are exceptionally well crafted and the relationship between them are organic and easy to like  this gives every scene that we used to cheer for godzilla appearingusing heat ray an entirely different atmosphere     we see the level of destruction closely on the ground and the amount of damage being done to the precious rebuild effort is heartbreaking for the audience and of course how the loss of lives and rebuild effort destroyed extinguished the hope and optimism along as well    it also does something rarely seen in western cinema nowadays where plots are mostly in the extremes look at how mighty our nation is vs look at how terrible and shameful our past is the former is vanishing even  while not saying these movies dont have their importance but very rarely do we get any movies that brings the nation together through collective pain and bring in positivity despite all odds    while some would call this an antiwar movie this is more about existentialism which is a common theme in japanese works and ironically this philosophy originated from francegermany post world war 1 and frankly has vanished from most western literarycinema     overall for the average audience this is a great movie with great sound tracksound effect decent visual for godzilla fans this brings back the horror and og godzilla feel   for movie lovers this is a great work about humanity and japans spirit a reminisce of the peak japanese movie decades from the 70s    japan is on its path of economic recovery with great results in sportsarts etc in the past few years  this movie and shin godzilla are love letters to the japanese people for their resilient and willing to take responsibility for a better future despite all the flaws from the system or the past

im a 48 year old life long godzilla fan  i believe that minus one is the best modern godzilla film since 2001s  gmk  besides a few non distracting nods to the 1954 film minus one is very different from the rest   it has a very strong and compelling human story  it probably has the best writing of any godzilla film in that regards  it may be set in a post war japan but it is far from being a remake of the 1954 film

this is hands down the best movie ive seen this year its oscarworthy and thats not hyperbole the script is perfect the themes explored are deep and heartfelt  the postwar trauma of an entire nation survivor guilt shame ptsd what makes a family love redemption forgiving others forgiving oneself the value of life and choosing to live in the face of terrible odds youd never think a movie about a giant monster stomping on stuff would make you feel for and root for the human characters but godzilla minus one does just that  i cant say this enough  go watch it if you were ever a godzilla fan go watch it even if you were never a godzilla fan go watch it this movie is easily one of the best movies of 2023  and all for a very modest 15 milliondollar budget compared to the hundreds of millions hollywood pours into its often disappointing blockbusters

ok normally a godzilla movie especially made by toho is always pretty cheesy with the guy in a suit stomping tokyo   yeah it is godzilla but theres most likely never going to be an oscar for the actors      i just got back from the newest godzilla movie godzilla minus one   it is excellent and this is one that should be seen in the theaters      now how do you tell an epic story and make it a great movie too  you do it not by telling about the main event but about the people who are in the main event  a good example of this is saving private ryan   if it was just a regular war movie showing nothing but dday it would have been ok but just mediocre   however it was a great movie because it focused not on dday but on one character private ryan and how to get him home      so narrow the story down to one person or just a few      godzilla minus one has done this  it is the story of a japanese kamikaze pilot who chickened out and due to this he has massive guilt  something else happened no spoilers where he chickened out again so now he has to go home to a devastated tokyo that was destroyed by the fire bombing campaign at the end of wwii    the story focuses on him and his new family and about him trying to get over the ptsd of wwii        this is why the new godzilla movie is excellent because it has a great story  it is not just about the giant lizard who shoots nuclear beams

finally godzilla gets a movie worthy of him and its actually not about him  dont misunderstand if you like the alpha dog titan stomping and breathing atomic breath youre going to like this but thats a vehicle to move the cast through a poignant story of regaining dignity and burying the ghosts of the past as a boomer i grew up with godzilla and understood very well he was a metaphor for the atomic age  then over time he devolved into  almost a joke  his rebirth in the 2014 godzilla was amazing if you love the monster and a decent enough movie overall but i cant tell you that until today ive seen an actually great piece of cinema in the entirety of the catalog  the 1954 original being maybe the closest  well i have now

just like with shin gojira we finally have another director that truly understands the meaning behind gojira    the horror and trauma of war completely front and center of the plot and driving force behind the story gojira is back as he was originally intended a true manifestation of what the civilians of japan endured in wwii from the actions of both the japanese government and united states from the japanese government abandoning their civilians to starve sacrifice and waste away to the bombings from the united states we can also see this by just witnessing the countless deaths we see on screen    this is a true force of gojira and the unstoppable threat of his mere existence the american godzilla as an idea is nothing compared to gojira    the only thing holding me back from a higher rating is a few instances of poorlyhandled visual effects and the terrible choice for a title name

incredible movie with great storyline and returning to godzillas roots with mass destruction    my two kids 10 and 12 loved it   i highly suggest you tell your kids the backdrop beforehand i explained ww2 which they knew about but went into detail on how tokyo was demolished and what kamikaze pilots were and their purpose   subtitles were not an issue for my kids i wouldnt take very young kids tho since there is a story going on besides just a monster that a young child will totally miss out on if they cant read substitutes or have a limited vocabulary     this is more than just a monster movie tho godzilla creature was in fine form  the kamikazes storyline was nicely done   the overall storyline was realistic too and the movie had very few implausible situations which is essential to enjoyment    everyone clapped at the end of the movie and there were all ages there   now i understand the reave reviews and 98 rotten tomato rating

i struggle to think of anything that i dislike about this film     despite my 5 stars this isnt a perfect film make no mistake  i wish we saw more godzilla the water effects at times were a bit meh especially regarding the foam     but i left the cinema feeling happy and satisfied this is a great film that i have to nitpick to find fault with it the acting was incredible the characters were likeable and fleshed out i felt for the characters godzillas actions were terrifying  i felt like the characters were on the precipice of death  without feeling overwhelmed and smothered by hopelessness  in fact i felt the opposite  hope a really powerful message  which perhaps towards the end gets a little obvious  but my oh my  this film earns its ending    55  a must watch for godzilla fans  a must watch for monster movies fans

it is officially the golden age of godzilla never before have we had such consistent quality godzilla content its been building since godzilla 2014 and it just peaked    godzilla minus one is perhaps the greatest godzilla film since the original there is an argument for it being considered the best better than godzilla 54 this godzilla fires on all cylinders not just as a creature but the movie as a whole godzilla himself is perfect but everything else in the movie is held to that same standard there is no weak part the humans are just as important as goji and their stories are more compelling than the giant radioactive lizard at one point i genuinely forgot it was a godzilla movie and i had to remind myself goji was going to return and bring death and destruction with him    this version of godzilla is like nothing weve seen before he is not an animal he is not a force of nature he is worse pick any god of death destruction andor annihilation and he is that idea brought to life he is malicious at every opportunity he is the most menacing weve ever seen godzilla he is more powerful and destructive than any previous versions of godzilla any scenes with goji attacking are outstanding nothing is held back and surprisingly the effects are done so well they stand up to aaa hollywood films his heat ray is breathtaking its so beautiful and destructive seeing this in theaters is a must the sound design and visuals do a fantastic job making you feel the sheer power being unleashed    everything about this film hit ive never been so proud to be a godzilla fan the story the plot the acting the characters the themes the action the destruction godzillas design the sound design the soundtrack everything for this film is done with care with effort nothing falls short you could take godzilla out of this film and everything else would still stand tall on its own i genuinely think this will win awards and will usher in a new age of japanese cinema hollywood should be taking notes on how to make lower budget movies its mind blowing that a japanese film with a 1520 million budget was better than any 200 million hollywood film that came out this year    i could praise this movie for days straight im going to go see it again and bring everyone i can with me to the theaters its hard to rate a movie as perfect but this movie is as perfect as any movie has been this year    if you like historical dramas go see this film    if you like massive destruction sequences go see this film    if you like godzilla go see this film    if you like good movies go see this film    dont miss maybe the best movie of 2023

a phenomenal and heartwarming movie of redemption the story of survivors guilt and dealing with ptsd should hit home and inspire and btw godzilla was in it the action scenes were more engaging and realistic than any cgi or digitized work could ever capture one truly feels the horror and destructive power in each and every encounter absolutely the best godzilla movie i have ever seen and one of the best movies period in the last 25 years this one should go in for oscar contention under at least best foreign film but more appropriately under best film i would pay to see this at least a couple more times

an excellent film due to fine acting of characters the viewer truly relates to and cares for    imax is wholly unnecessary for screening because of that a theater room with strong audio may aid in evoking emotional response but so could one playing in mono    and such an impression extends to visuals a larger screen does not at all evoke response acting does visually at one point a viewer may wish that director takashi yamazaki had put someone in a rubber godzilla suit letting the viewers imagination further work however one begins to see that the creatures cgi deliberately made to look as if someone is in just such a rubber suit is thoughtfully done in respectful homage to the original 1954 godzilla film yamazaki proves that creativity can and does exist even when barraged by current digital special effects and at less expense than that spent by the us film industry    the storyline and dialogue also could be anime  right down to the happily ever after ending  yet truly fit into the classical kaiju mold in which they brilliantly portray the life of a young family and postwwii japanese community    and this film is edited well never once does one wonder how much time remains before credits    overall godzilla minus one is a jubilant shock at how enjoyable a movie  can be after years of drudging superhero special effects stories where thischanges nothing but ones pocketbook

godzilla minus one is a competent wellshot addition to the series  although its much better than any of the drivel produced by legendary pictures it still leaves much to be desired  good acting is offset by terribly written dialogue and theres plenty of dubious cgi on display throughout the film  the human drama is at the forefront  with the titular kaiju taking a backseat to what is a decent although ploddingly paced story  overall a decent film and easily within the top halfdozen godzilla films but it cant contend with a masterpiece like the 1954 original or a gripping contemporary take like shin godzilla   not bad just severely overhyped

this movie gives us a peek into japan after ww2 that we rarely get to see the mix of defeat japan had after ww2 and the search for a identity brought together by the need to defeat godzilla who is rampaging throw a country finding its identity the clash of war and peace identity and obscurity to build a new japan as reality of what happened moves them forward to a new japan as much as this is a story about a monster it is also a story about the people trying to grow past ww2 and the culture during the war to achieve self worth again for a bright future of japan godzilla represents victory of achieving this goal of a new identity by doing it better for a brighter future

2023s godzilla minus one is essentially a faithful remakeretelling of the 1954 original keeping  instilling the message  morals of the original film whereas the original film focused more on godzilla  the destruction of japan with the struggle  emotions of the japanese people being more the backdrop to the main characters of the original film ie godzilla  the city itself minus one however subverts this expectation and focuses more on character development with the human characters themselves the screen time we do get of godzilla rampaging throughout japan  the destruction he causes though more breif than i was wanting is a sight to be hold and leaves a significant impact just wish there was more of it

if you are a godzilla fan then this is a must see movie   be warned it is a fully japanese film with subtitles so if you arent into that you may want to wait for a dubbed version but the film is worth watching this way if you can do it     while the film is not perfect theres quite a few things lost in translation and there are a few choices in how it is put together that i would have done differently its still a great movie   if you just want a mindless monster movie like the legendary pictures godzilla you will likely not enjoy this one as much this is more of the thinking mans godzilla like the original   but if you are a fan of godzillas classic storytelling and solid themes that are heavy in morality emotion and thoughtfulness then this is a film to see in big screen   this one evokes the best format of godzilla the eminent threat to and enemy of humanity that we have to struggle to deal with and it touches at the heart and soul of the original film and all its successors into shin gojira   the characters and archetypes are fun though predictable but they are more about carrying the message and theme of the film rather than being fully fleshed out entities   the visuals are gorgeous and really nail the time period feeling and make godzilla feel threatening and savage theres some truly awesome moments in there and some legit tense scenes     the main drawback i have is with the pacing especially early on as we dont really get to know the characters they simply drop in which is a bit of a letdown and sometimes confusing     overall i would definitely give this a recommend i would have been more comfortable with a 45 star rating but i felt it deserves more than 4 for what the director cast and crew accomplished

it is a godzilla movie with a ton of character development and not a lot of kaiju action imho  granted when godzilla is on the screen its pretty awesome but hes not on much for a kaiju movie  godzilla does have the most awesome new atomic breath ive ever seen  i mean it is so wickedly wild that no other kaiju would want to be on the receiving end of it  yet most of the movie is more of a character study with godzilla as more of an afterthought at times  i mean it is about people living in japan right after wwii  its a decent movie but not a hardcore kaiju one for me  one thing about it is that the japanese military isnt in it much  after wwii they didnt have much working weapons and as part of the treaty were required to remove weapons from vessels etc  so godzilla goes up against homemade stuff vice the laser cannons etc from previous movies

i have been a godzilla fan for over 31 years at this point i have seen every film in the series ive been lucky enough to see godzilla 98 godzilla 2000 millennium godzilla 14 shin godzilla and godzilla king of the monsters in the cinema so it was a genuine treat to see godzilla minus one i live in the middle of nowhere so it was an hour long drive but the drive home was good thinking time     this movie has opinions it has very clear things to say about war valuing life and individual peoples role in society it has big acting huge displays of human emotion consider the collective strain and trauma and how overwhelmed youd been in these situations     luckily for us the big acting is attached to legitimately interesting characters who you dont want to see get squashed by godzilla because for the first time in a long time godzilla is a dick this verison of godzilla reminds me of godzilla mothra king ghidorah giant monsters all out attack 2001 in how much he just hates if he sees a person that person dies unless they get away or at least out of sight he will tolerate none in his way     to continue i echo much of what youve probably already read impressive visual effects especially for the budget the plot is good and you have characters you like the score is not overly dependent on ifukube but the expected themes are there and they are exceptional updates the original music is generally good with a few haunting themes i liked the sound design was great actually and i liked when the film chose to slow down and be quiet for a few minutes     fans of the godzilla series will probably notice the nods to the past and i feel that it was done well with the easter eggs being fairly subtle rather than overtly shoved in your face     if youre only familiar with the legendary monsterverse godzilla this movie is very different this is a postwwii antiwar drama about survivors guilt ptsd found family and the value of human life there just happens to be some incredible monster scenes and exciting action scenes but its a drama i loved it go see it while its in theaters

this movie painted in despair will strike you with fear  director takashi yamasaki    oh my godzilla    im utterly speechless this movie was amazing in every possible way imaginable for an audience wanting to be entertained the human characters were very well written the acting was outstanding the emotions were strong with loss pride and hope the main cast were perfect together as a group even the minor characters were amazing the music oh my god the music was conducted to fit every scene it was in and the og theme was incredible to hear in a dolby theater for the first time akira ifukube would be proud may he rest in peace lastly it was very educating in a way to see what japan was like immediately after the war following the atomic bombs the hardships they went through just to rebuild was very emotional to watch but the way they climbed out of that pit of hopelessness would inspire any viewer to the franchise both long time along with newer fans    now to the matter at hand the star himself godzilla    the king of the monsters is more terrifying in this movie than any other in the 69 year history of the longest running franchise in the world every time he appears on screen he strikes fear into your very soul and leaves you in awe at the same time his destruction was unrelenting the action out of this world his power godly his portrayal very real at times you almost feel sorry for him because whats happened to him wasnt his fault i havent seen a monster movie this well done since peter jacksons king kong 2005 and cloverfield 2008    my solid review of this movie is a 1010 and i recommend save notifications of any kind for when this movie hits the home media market because i sure will    honestly i dont think ive ever watched a movie this perfect before    last note the whole theater shook everytime godzilla took a step and my very bones were vibrating from his roar  godzilla godzilla1954 godzillaminusone monster japan

im a lifelong godzilla fan okay obsessive but believe me when i say that this may be the best in the series since the 1954 debut and a film that can and should be appreciated by anyone everything works in this original inventive film  the visuals and creature design the believable story given the irradiated monster in the middle of it and the human drama that is so often the boring bits between atomic destruction  even if you have franchise fatigue book your tickets for this one  well be talking about it for years

phenomenal movie godzilla is insane and the humans in the movie are fantastic

when godzilla arrived at tokyo for the first time and his main theme started playing everyone in my theater lost their minds it was so nostalgic hearing godzillas main suite playing whilst he was destroying tokyo godzillas atomic breath scene was also one of the coolest things ive ever seen in a movie his atomic breath is literally like a nuke exploding one of my favorite parts of the movie was when godzilla got half his head blown off and he instantly regenerated it another cool part of this movie is when godzilla dies and it cuts to a shot of a piece of godzilla flesh regenerating teasing a potential sequel i forgot to mention how awesome these human characters are i actually cared for these characters and i was worried for them throughout the movie  unlike past godzilla films  also can i mention how awesome the human story is this is possibly the best human story ive ever seen in a godzilla film the plot to kill godzilla was so creative in my opinion sinking godzilla to the bottom of the ocean so the sea pressure would crush him and then when they bring godzilla back to the surface to finish the job it was so dang awesome one of my favorite things about this film was the fact it had so many references to the old godzilla movies i noticed at least a few dozen references i found out after i watched this movie that this films budget was 15 million dollars for reference godzilla vs kongs budget was 155200 million dollars getting to see godzilla be the bad guy again was a nice breath of fresh air i simply cannot put into words how much i enjoyed watching this film arguably the best godzilla film ever made

if you are a die hard godzilla fan if youve not seen this what the hell is wrong with you this movie in my eyes is a prequel to the original gojira and is worth 10 million stars out of 5  seeing godzilla regenerate on the big screen where he regenerated part of his face holy cow and his heart was slowly regenerating in the water

not just a great godzilla movie its a great movie period great story about war and the cost of war friendship and family the last line of the movie hit pretty hard especially if you or a loved one has served in the military plus it has godzilla highly recommended

i recently watched the original 1954 godzilla movie and found it a great balance of monster movie and emotional drama id suggest that the time and the movie culture of japan in that time made the latter aspect a difficult challenge but they did manage it subsequent godzilla movies that ive seen have not provided this for me but i fully acknowledge this isnt a franchise ive devoted myself to so there are likely many that achieve this    so that said i struggle to remember a movie that i was more impressed with or enjoyed more it was astonishingly good with personal grief and emotion seriously frightening scenes of devastations and actual im not crying youre crying moments in a godzilla movie i really felt this wasnt a movie of monster devastation but boy howdy was there monster and devastation but a movie about people and how the heck would they deal with this catastrophe just shortly after the war that theyd barely survived    youll hear a lot about this film go see it so you can be the one who saw it first okay this might be a little marketing        ive tried to avoid saying its the best movie ive seen in years but others are saying similar things     like forbes magazine for example the latest reboot godzilla minus one is one of 2023s greatest films and the result is that godzilla minus one is the best godzilla film ever made and a masterpiece of kaiju cinema
wow he was angry and just wow toho nailed it this time
that scene where they put the bombs around godzilla and theme playing my lord it the best movie this year by a land slide

phenomenal movie that really nails godzilla it perfectly portrays the scenes with the titular creature as terrifying and conveys the despair the story is really good and you care for the characters worrying about what might happen to them as they encounter godzilla its a great movie

didnt think id say this about a godzilla movie but i really cared about the humans well crafted characters that actually had you emotionally invested in them and their relationships not only to each other but also to the star of the show himself godzilla this is also the best looking and most realistic godzilla ever and i remember thinking multiple times wow they really put a lot of money into this movie then i found out the budget was only 15 million that made the movie even more impressive than it already was dont see this movie at home as your first experiencesee it in the theatre its not only a love letter to godzilla fans but a great film for all movie fans in general not doubt godzilla minus one is in the top 3 godzilla films of alltime if not the greatest 55

to be honest i have only ever seen the american godzilla films which is why i was really excited when i heard this japanese production was getting a wide release and as someone new to this franchise minus one floored me  the acting is fantastic the characters are endearing the cinematography is gorgeous the music is awesome the effects are fantastic and godzilla is terrifying  i have but one spoilerfilled flaw with this film and thats it  this is a staggeringly fantastic blockbuster it delivered so much of everything that i wanted as a newcomer to this franchise that i can only imagine how ecstatic longtime godzilla fans will be watching this film

this movie is a masterpiece it is one of the rare movies where i felt a true emotional connection to the human characters often in a godzilla film you want more godzilla and less of the plot humans but this movie hit the perfect balance this is a movie about family about the value of life and returns godzilla back to its serious origins the effects are also a spectacle never have i seen such a clear view at godzilla and have him move in such an organic way a monstrous godzilla paired with a somber and beautiful plot there has never been a better godzilla film in theater

godzilla minus one may be one of if not the best film in the entire godzilla franchise    our main protagonists in the film are engaging and show us the struggles of post war japan we feel their sorrow and pain as well as their faith as they push for a better future    as for the big g himself wow every time he is on screen you are on the edge of your seat his presence is horrifying and majestic at the same time he is a walking atomic bomb and it shows    1110
such a great movie smart mature thoughtful made by competent people with a really great artistic vision

the godzilla films have long suffered from lackluster writing for the human characters dont get me wrong i have seen every godzilla movie and have been a fan since i was a kid but its always been about watching monsters destroying cities godzilla minus one feels like a complete movie package great characters great acting a smart plot and a godzilla that is actually scary go see this one in the theater

as a long time godzilla fan i went into this film with high expectations and toho certainly didnt disappoint not only does this film hold an empathetic and engaging human cast but it also tells a tonal and dramatic story of guilt a soldiers duty and the aftermath of war personally i wouldve enjoyed this as a standalone film but the biggest cherry on top is how godzilla was seamlessly weaved into the story godzilla actually played a large roll in the main characters motivations and development rather than the typical random obstacle to overcome godzilla himself harkens back to the original 1954 version a terrifying monster a force of nature with no rhyme or reason disturbed by humanitys meddling godzilla in this film is terrifying even more so than 2016s shin godzilla overall i only had minor critiques throughout the film and despite personally finding the ending a bit disappointing i think the rest of the film makes up for it completely this film is not only an example of how to make an amazing monster movie but also just an amazing movie in general 1010

this movie was absolutely amazing it had an amazing story line and the characters in the movie were not useless to the story line also the movie did a great job in making the viewers actually care about the humans and what happens to them they did a great job with the cgi making godzilla look real over all this movie was a 910 definitely a must watch
one of the best godzilla films ever created and should be seen by everyone

one of the greatest pieces of cinema ever out to screen a sobering retelling of the original 1954 film godzilla minus one 2023 displays the crippling tragedy of war through the metaphor of the monster who has and always will do it best the film is a true emblem of the broken postwar japan the feelings of disgrace and overwhelming trauma of the war are expertly woven into the characters and their narrative providing a gripping human element that gives to heart and weight to the film a culmination of a nearly 70 year legacy godzilla minus one 2023 is perhaps the best and most raw godzilla has ever been

godzilla minus one was a very emotional piece with easily the best human story in the franchise and quite a classic movie feel i know this will definitely be one of my favorite films of all time for the rest of my life

monster disappointment  the writerdirector takashi yamazaki talked this up as a film that would capture the horror terror and despair that godzilla would create if real  the teasers and trailers all mirrored that description but the actual movie is 10 godzilla and 90 human melodrama  i am one of those godzilla fans  the ones who go to a godzilla movie to see godzilla not the human characters  i never felt any connection to any of the characters and found myself looking at my watch during the last 40 minutes of the film  i understand a lot of godzilla fans love this movie but i was not one of them

best godzilla movie ive ever seen its amazing to see what this team did with a 15 million dollar budget great storyline and even better visual effects its a must watch on the big screen i prefer the original japanese with english subtitles viewing if you can make it

incredible a fresh real human look at a genre we think we know godzilla has become enshrined mythos in japanese culture and here it is examined through the eyes of authentic characters played by a superb cast for truly the first time despite the phenomenal special effects we have seen him in the recent monsterverse films the creature is terrifyingly real the cast and plot aided by top notch direction has given us dare i say it an oscar worthy tale for the ages

as far as godzilla movies go minus one is among the best of the best taking us back to a traumatic period in japanese history it reflects on japans place in the war and how godzilla itself is now a representation of trauma it has great characters great music great action and utilises its budget well great film
the best godzilla movie yet

godzilla minus one is one of if not the best godzilla movie out there right now the pacing is perfect the story is phenomenal when godzilla shows up it is extremely tense and youre on the edge of your seat rooting for the characters the visual effects and design of godzilla is some of the best ive ever seen and its not just godzilla whos awesome every character is well thought out and has their time to shine it is a perfect balance of human and godzilla and they even benefit each other which isnt as common as it should be i also want to say the sound design was extraordinary when godzilla is on screen you dont just see him you hear him too definitely a movie to see in the best screentheater possible i also want to mention the music was also amazing  it was so cool to hear a ton of classic godzilla music and the new music made for this film is possibly better than the classic music i walked into godzilla minus one expecting an amazing movie but it was an experience i walked out of and one i want to relive over and over again
must watch in 4dx theater story is compelling and the action is amazing heat ray steals the show

by far best godzilla movie in terms of story and fx  if there was anything bad it would be not enough monster but then you run risk of boring movie so they really focused on character development so much that it feels like a post war drama with godzilla as a backdrop  what was interesting was the plan to kill the monster which was very creative and just something you never see the humans do in such a film which is fight head on with the monster
loved it returned to a classic format and godzilla looked amazing

sorry this film had too many lapses in logic and was marred by poor stilted onenote acting to be effective i mean the best performance was by the young girl thats kind of sad you know   the premise is good but whats on screen just progresses from one scene to the next like everyone is going through the motions maybe the only scene with any urgency takes place on the boat when the crew of four first encounters godzilla   and seeing how the us base in ginza must surely have been destroyed its incredulous to believe the us wouldnt get involved if the director had wanted to get away with a pure fantasy film hed have done better to set it 200 years in the past wwii memories are still very much alive and rewriting history like this is risky business

yamazakis minus one is an essay on maximizing a modest budget by employing excellent character development that grounds this godzilla outing to a degree that audiences havent seen since the 1954 original  its a visceral tour de force with all the money on screen  an engaging often poignant dramatic piece about community ptsd and survivors guilt along with self redemption  the godzilla set pieces are utterly riveting but its the uniformly superb ensemble cast that will cement minus one as one of the best films of 2023 and its standing within the kaiju pantheon

an intelligent emotional story about post war trauma and survival that just happens to have a radioactive monster arrive to add to the wartime devastation   this is a movie that proves that you can blend realistic characters dealing with authentic problems with fantastical elements and make a compelling story  in japanese with subtitles as it should be  the characters and situations are so well developed you could watch it without translation and still understand the film   kudos also for the attention to detail regarding the use of wwii japanese military equipment and warships that are relevant to the story   and godzilla  he never looked better  true to the original 1954 version but with details not possible using traditional effects    this is one enraged and destructive creature   this is  a godzilla movie that makes you forget the underwhelming monsterverse offerings  go see it
masterpiece it earns that 98 rt score and so much more no thanks to adam does movies the only negative critic review i urge anyone to see this movie you will come out more than satisfied

i went to an early showing of the film on november 29th it was a lastminute decision spurred by my love of kaiju films and a desire to see new movies i invited a few friends and when leaving the theatre we were speechless with only one thing to say we need to watch this again i was blown out of the water by the superb acting and the amazing visuals i am not an emotional person especially with films but i teared up and cried at 2 distinct points in the movie when watching most monster films you wish for the razing of cities and the visual of the destruction and loss of life here is quite the opposite believable human characters that you immediately fall in love with i see this movie as one that is a mustsee and at that a mustsee on the big screen fans of kaiju films jaws and jurassic park will surely enjoy 1010 no complaints

if it aint the best godzilla movie to come out since the original its close in the runnings this is the movie that casual fans and movie goers can jump into and do so along side the crowd who fell in love with the people in rubber suits fair warning watch the trailers for the movie its the majority of the movie minus the final act how you feel during that minute and a half trailer is how you are going to feel the entire 2 hour runtime by the time the credits hit you will be exhausted and the movie will run rent free in your head the rest of your night see it as early as possible if you want to see it with the fans of the big guy for all these decades wait for the applause that will come from the crowded theater at the end     the story will keep you invested the pain you feel will be along side the characters who might face death at a moments notice when they are not trying to rebuild not just their lives but their broken selves godzilla is a money shot every frame he is on that camera the cinematography and the sound editing is insanely pulled through it was like the director had a sense of playfulness with his vision for maximum impact there is a double usage of godzillas original theme for his rampage but each use is done differently with the music pushing on a sense of beautiful irony as we get to our climactic moment even more interesting is its multitude of themes themes are very prevalent in this movie you have failure and shame sins of the past what dictates a family a subtle hint at the end of samurai culture as they tackle the notion of self sacrifice for the greater good and how as a nation they should look forward a strong antiwar message in my view a smaller one is this is a movie made by the grandsons of those alive during that time the ones who felt the effects of the ending of ww2 japan the original 1950s movie was a sense of a nation processing the atom bomb this movie is the next generations message going forward while looking at their own past

godzilla minus one is a masterpiece surpassing even godzilla 1954 in my opinion i consider it the best godzilla film ever made effectively it serves as a perfect remake of the 1954 classic devoid of 1950s american film restrictions for japanese film it sets out to tell a story of loss and hope narrating it in such a masterful way that you become attached to the characters without the need for language you could enter this film with no prior knowledge of its plot and emerge utterly stunned    as a godzilla fan i anticipated greatness but what i experienced left me so awestruck that i found myself unable to speak for a good 20 minutes every aspect of the film from the setting tone characters sound design soundtrack cinematography to the visual effects surpasses my ability to articulate how amazing it was especially when watching it in imax    what truly blows my mind is its modest budget of 15 million dollars it efficiently utilizes every dollar or technically yen so well that i find it challenging to return to most western entertainment without noticing flaws it genuinely brings joy to identify myself as a godzilla fan

i am a godzilla fan so all comments should be taken with that in mind  this movie met my every expectation  the characters are engaging the story is clear and the threat of the monster feels believable there is a touch of melodrama but given the setting and the events it would understandable that emotions run high  the characters delve a little into simplification and trope but this is a movie about a giant lizard so accuracy should be tempered  there is an elaborate plan to destroy the monster that is in keeping with godzilla history but nothing that is hokey  the acting is a little old fashioned but feels true to the historical setting  the visuals are wonderful  it is clear that they are not billion dollar but they are very good and in some ways had a better gut feeling  there may have been some practical model work or a concerted effort to reach that look depth of field as an homage  there are few clear homages to the original godzilla and some other movies but nothing distracting  there are few scenes of big g in action that were quite brutal in his effect on a recovering japanese population  his smaller size in comparison to recent movies works better for this movie there is some interesting pointofview camera work that went a long way to giving you the feeling of experiencing it firsthand the fact that it is subtitles only occurred to me the next day so clearly that did not distract i do prefer this over dubbing   overall a great effort by all involved i highly recommend for the casual or diehard fan  you will not be disappointed  some one who has no experience with godzilla do such people exist may come away wondering what all the fuss is about

toho returns godzilla to its atomic roots with a story line that predates the original 1954 film the human drama reminded me of some of the early akira kirosawa films and the monster footage delivers in spades i am one of those longtime fans who still feels shin godzilla is one of the series best this film is at least as good as that one and at times perhaps better minus one manages to bring the character back to its original storyline but still manages to feel refreshing and even frightening at times i think the people behind most of the original series especially ishiro honda would be proud of this film if they were still with us highly highly recommended

as lifelong fan of godzilla i already had high expectations for godzilla minus one let me tell you this movie did not disappoint im certainly not one to love a godzilla movie just because of franchise loyalty im not afraid to criticize a godzilla movie however i dont think i have any criticisms of this film     if i had to describe this movie in one word it would be refreshing the downtoearth plot the genuine fear this movie provoked the new aspects of godzilla explored even the enticing human elements this movie brought with it godzilla minus one was such a refreshing film for the nearly 70 year old running franchise    with over 30 films under its belt one might question if theres anything novel a new installment could bring godzilla minus one confidently answers that question with a resounding yes godzilla minus one was a story worth telling and they executed it flawlessly

this movie is just great it has a human story as well as tons of destruction i rewatched kong vs godzilla the other day to compare them next to godzilla minus 1 its not even a popcorn flick just a lame story interrupted by i admit cool cgi effects     dont get put off by subtitles and japanese language if you do you will miss a truly great monster movie

wow i would rank this as one of my top five favorite films of 2023 i was lucky enough to catch a fan event prescreening     just from watching the previews i had a feeling that it was going to be wellworth watching in a theater because of its production quality what i did not expect was that it was going to be a highstakes drama this movie is gripping heartwrenching quite frightening and more suspenseful than anything i expected if i tried to compare it to another movie it would have to be watching the original jaws for the first time there is one scene in particular when godzilla is pursuing our hero who is in his wornout tub of a minesweeper but this was even better than that    the director does an excellent job of sucking you into the horror and sadness of postwar japan it only took a few minutes for me to become heavily invested in the hero and then each of the side characters his foundfamily and friends the director also gives you the origin of godzilla and you can actually sense the difference in energy between his original and final form godzilla is furious vicious violent and horrific the violence in the film does not feel gratuitous  you are going to experience the shock and horror of the victims the airplane mechanics the people in ginza the unfortunates on the various ships and the ptsd the hero has from his encounters with godzilla unlike the godzilla movies from the 60s on you arent going to be able to savor the mayhem quite so much unless you lack human empathy    if you are going just to see godzilla you wont be disappointed though wow he is monstrous the graphics of him destroying ginza are incredible but it is when he is at sea that i found him to be the most frightening on land it seems like there is a chance to get away from him at sea it is a different story entirely     and finally there is a more realistic quality to this movie than the vast majority of monster movies in particular i liked how the plan they come up with to battle godzilla it felt thoughtful and possible    great fun dont pass up the chance to watch it in the theater
as a fan who has seen every godzilla movie godzilla minus one takes everything great in the past entrys and expands upon it the movie definitely deserves a 100 rating
a nostalgic remake of the original which mixes loss and tragedy with the hope in postwar japan

best godzilla film to date perfect blend of monster meets man the human side of the movie was a gut punch that you couldnt look away from nor wanted to look away from the characters were well written and real no one felt safe from the destruction and the relationships between characters tugged heartstrings lets not forget the biggest part of the movie godzilla by far the most terrifying and stunning version of the monster to date the special effects and look of this were fanominal when first seeing the big g in action for the first time i could only stare slackjawed this movie made me feel all the emotions and showed no mercy a real love letter to fans and to film making too thank you so much for this

godzilla a captivating enigma of destruction with a stellar score    godzilla the iconic king of the monsters has captivated audiences for decades with its aweinspiring size and destructive power while many fans adore the creature as a symbol of natures untamed might others view it as a mindless force of destruction devoid of any redeeming qualities this film however manages to strike a delicate balance between these opposing perspectives revealing the creatures enigmatic nature while also highlighting the plight of the human characters caught in its path    from the outset the film establishes godzilla as an unpredictable force of nature its actions driven by primal instincts rather than any discernible logic its destruction is not motivated by malice but by a desperate need for survival and a yearning for connection this enigmatic nature is precisely what makes godzilla so captivating keeping audiences on the edge of their seats and wondering what it will do next    at the same time the film does not neglect the human element portraying the characters as complex individuals struggling to survive in the face of unspeakable devastation their desperation to avoid godzillas wrath and their resilience in the face of overwhelming odds underscore the creatures immense power and the profound fear it inspires    the films masterstroke lies in its ability to balance these two perspectives allowing audiences to appreciate godzillas enigmatic nature while also empathizing with the plight of the human characters this delicate balance elevates the film from mere monsterbashing spectacle to a profound exploration of the delicate balance between destruction and compassion    furthermore the films score deserves special mention the music is both epic and emotional perfectly capturing the films themes of destruction and resilience the score is one of the best ive heard in any film this year and it greatly enhances the overall viewing experience    in conclusion godzilla is a captivating film that succeeds in capturing both the allure of the enigmatic beast and the struggles of the human characters caught in its path its ability to balance these two perspectives coupled with its stellar score makes it a mustsee for fans of the genre and newcomers alike    rating 5 out of 5 stars

godzilla minus one was perfection blending classic godzilla with modern action and visuals to create something so memorable emotional and haunting godzilla is a force more than ever and the story couldnt have been more touching this took my breath away    for starters the humans are some of if not the best in any godzilla film the story and journey these characters go through feel earned and by the end of the film you feel and care for each and everyone of them    godzilla was an absolute force to be reckoned with his atomic breath might actually be my new favorite of the franchise the ocean scene kept me frozen he was haunting extremely powerful and looked phenomenal which leads me to talking about the effects leaving the theater all i could think about was the saddest part of watching that film was knowing that it probably wont get the recognition it deserves come award season especially for its effects the cgivisual effect were all polished not once did it dip in quality    the score for this film was beyond beautiful touching at times i got emotional just by music queues multiple times during the film at times it was bone chilling hype and gut wrenching other times seat clenching and even had elementsfull tracks from the original    it was emotional action packed had a beautiful story gorgeous visuals and brisk pacing that never dragged godzilla is the monster we all hoped for with humans that felt tangible this is one for the ages and i mean that with zero hesitation actually minus one    i highly recommend seeing this in theaters as soon as possible but please make sure its on the biggest screen you can find

godzilla minus one spoiler review    101    at this time i cannot decide if i like minus one better or my old favorite godzilla against mechagodzilla first things first this is by far the best version of godzilla i knew as soon as takashi yamazaki was making it the design was going to be amazing just by his godzilla in its always sunny on third street what i didnt expect was everything else this godzilla movie is 100 a horror movie the beginning scene with godzilla as a more dinosaur like creature was amazing thats the kind of godzillasaurus i wanted to see his atomic breath is awesome the spikes coming out and going in was fine i didnt like it any more or any worse that the normal glowing spikes but the atomic breath itself is beautiful with godzilla being the metaphor for the bombing of japan his atomic breath actually creating a nuke like explosion was a perfect touch i didnt realize godzilla needed and his death at the end was the second best godzilla death in my opinion nothing can beat heisei melting down now the actual plot unlike most godzilla films this movie has one of the best character driven storys its stars a kamikaze pilot who pretended that his plain was broken to skip out on dying the twist and turns his story had were so compelling i almost forgot about godzilla his later to be wifes death i saw coming but it later being revealed to fake with her actually surviving was the biggest twist in this movie there where many small nods to older godzilla films that will excite long time fans but thats not at all what makes this movie good while i had a heavily bias opinion on the movie my friend who has only seen shin godzilla also thought this movie was fantastic and of course every scene with the godzilla theme is amazing

im not sure it deserves to be 100 but it was entertaining great special effects fantastic acting from the principal actors and actually did something oppenheimer failed to do show the devastation and aftermath of the h bomb dropped on japan i enjoyed the secondary storyline immensely and even if you dont take any of that into consideration godzilla eats a freakin train in my opinion that trumps everything

hands down best godzilla movie since the original and frankly the best movie of the year  i was in awe of the imagery and godzilla was truly a spectacle  gritty and emotional every scene with godzilla felt ironically personal the human story was heartbreaking and also endearing  as a life long fan i am grateful for the respect shown for this iconic monster  visually so impressive with a raw human element that finally really works not seen since the first film  dare i say it might even get a few awards or noms

there was a great deal of character development in the movie a country still recovering from wwll the spirit of the movie was about recovery and wrestling with fear when faced with destruction once again by the ravages of godzilla the people draw close to take on an impossible task there was a great deal of tension between the two main characters and you expect a romance to bud but due to personal battles concerning the war the romance is not fully realized really heartbreaking at one point but not giving anything away the movie does not leave you disappointed as they battle godzilla and deal with the demons of the past i would say this was more of a drama than a old fashioned godzilla movie

excellent movie with exceptional character development and moving story there were no cheesy bits and was an overall excellent monster movie that happened to have great story telling with good acting a movie that showed the horros of war and promulgated a succinct commentary on government shortfalls and the perils of nuclear war my favorite godzilla movie by far and a must watch even for non g fans

this movie was astonishingly surprising and both as a critic and a godzilla fan it was well kept with a very intriguing human story and very well balanced monster scenery and interaction this movie defines what godzilla truly is and what a godzilla movie in the future or past could andor should be a very fantastic movie
the best godzilla film yet amazing twist on the original story it was deep dealing with ww2 and the atrocities of nuclear war and the aftermath of destruction

godzilla minus one is a cinematic masterpiece its seriously written like an oscar nomination film in terms of characterization of the cast im shocked to say this film did the impossible its either on the same tier as gojira 1954 or surpasses it sound design was remarkable too the director did a tremendous job giving us shots and sequences weve never seen before with godzilla easily a 1010

this is the greatest godzilla movie of the modern era     no shade thrown at the legendary pictures theyre a completely different monster pun partially intended but this godzilla proves that you dont need to keep making the kaiju bigger for them to be terrifying from his first appearance early in the film to the heartpounding climax this godzilla is closer to the humans he terrorizes than any since the original 1954 classic the difference in scale creates a completely different kind of dread  something in between a colossal apex predator and a force of nature    the people in this film for maybe the first time in the history of godzilla movies steal the show godzilla is the backdrop against which postwwii japan struggles with the horrors and guilt inherent in survival of mass destruction and whether or not those who came home from war ever truly stopped fighting it koichi shikishima and his found family challenge the audience to do more than simply keep surviving    i have seen many different iterations of godzilla over the decades minus one is the most successful version since the original king of the monsters to tell the story of nuclear horror and how humankind has to be willing to do more than fight to the death they need to find the strength to live

i just arrived home after watching the early screening brilliant on every level  human monster metaphoric every level  you care about the main characters their emotional trauma and their motivations this is an angry godzilla and it works because godzilla is a metaphor for the cruelty and senselessness of war
best godzilla best sound
a once in a generation film absolutely incredible one of the greatest monster films of all time

saw the movie in a dolby cinema theater and it was absolutely top tier i highly suggest you see this in at least imax or dolby as the sound experience is next level the human story really drives home the theme of fighting to live and not wasting life along with the messages learned from ww2 ptsd regret etc the human interactions really made this movie worth seeing and godzilla is the vessel we see through then when you focus on godzilla his class theme song roar and the heat raynuclear blast is eye  ear candy the only nitpick i have is that some cgi is a little weird with him and the backgroundscities overall no complaints 1010

got to go to the early access screening for an imax showing i am so happy they made a great godzilla movie and for only 15 million disney take notes you dont need to spend 200300 million to make great entertainment you need talented and passionate people this movie has a great and well told story you actually care about the human characters in this direction and cinematography were great the performances were good heck the visuals were good this is how you make a godzilla movie see this movie in a theater on the biggest screen you can find yes you have to read subtitles who cares you can still enjoy what this movie brings to the table i cant wait to see this again in a few days thank you toho for delivering on this movie one of the best movies of 2023 by far

the movie really surprised me godzilla actually feels monstrous he was actually terrifying and felt like a force of nature when on the screen additionally the human part of the story was not just the godzilla waiting room the story was engaging and i came to really care about what would happen to the cast of characters easily one of the best experiences ive had watching movies in 2023

im am not exaggerating at all when i say that this is one of the best movies ever made this is considering all genres and franchises one of the best movies of all time     there really isnt a single bad thing i have to say about godzilla minus one the cgi and other effects are great the human story is the best in any godzilla movie so far the action sequences are unparalleled and the way it all blends together is perfect this movie deserves every single nomination it got in the hochi film awards

japanese cinema has done what hollywood has been unable to do make an entertaining film with real human characters real human story arcs great action and a compelling story applause tears excitement  the audience was enthralled by this not another cookie cutter super hero movie or blockbuster no ridiculous story line or empty characters godzilla minus one is how movies should be made

best godzilla movie ive seen in years the atomic beam is the coolest how the dorsal plates pop out right before nuking the entire city and that one boat scene where the boat explodes great movie would come for part 2

after the first watch this movie might be my favorite godzilla movie of all time great acting good plot and the pacing was great never at any point during the movie did i ever feel bored godzilla feels terrifying in this adaptation especially when we first see him not only is this movie scary but it also does an amazing job at portraying post ww2 japan you can feel the desperation and depression in the characters throughout the movie overall i feel like it has a great mix of everything you would want in a movie and would definitely recommend it

this is the best solo godzilla film since its 1954 original film it was very well balanced out between the human characters and the kaiju himself and the story was very postwar feel especially for the citizens of japan and what the hardship they went through in the aftermath
great movie and story

godzilla minus one director takashi yamazaki has done it the film is a triumph     yamazakis mastery of vfx shines through in this latest godzilla movie seamlessly blending astonishing visuals with a gripping human story this entry into the godzilla franchise reads like a dramatic period piece with a monster horror element all the actors deliver heartfelt meaningful performances that connected me to their characters like no other godzilla film has before    i truly believe minus one will be remembered as an important piece of kaiju movie history its a movie that celebrates the endurance of the human spirit and our ability to evolve when thrust into the chaos of conflict while remaining accessible to both fans and newcomers alike
